date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2017
review_content: This is a very good quality suitcase.  It was the first hard case that I've bought.  For the most part, I am satisfied, but I wish I had known a couple more bits of information before I purchased.  If you are also buying YOUR FIRST HARD CASE, read these IMPORTANT TIPS.  TIP #1: This case closes with a ZIPPER ONLY.  It does not have a latch.  Zipper-only hard cases are more vulnerable to malfunction because zippers can break or split apart with stress or excessive wear.  If the zipper splits on this case, you do will have a latch as a backup method to keep your case closed and you may find your self in a predicament when you need to check your broken-zippered bag at the airport.  Therefore, if you buy this case, be sure to also buy luggage straps.  Luggage straps are extremely effective to keep your case closed and will help prevent excessive stress or damage to the zipper.  When buying luggage straps, write your initials on each strap with a permanent marker.  This will not only help identify your bag in a busy airport, but also make the straps less desirable for thieves.  TIP #2: I bought the (very large) 28-inch version of this case because I wanted to have plenty of space to pack for long international trips.  In hindsight, I wish I had bought a size or two smaller because filling up a case this big with normal items like clothing, shoes, and toiletries will almost always put you over the airline weight limits (and be very heavy to lift).  The case is very light, but I can only fill it up about 75% to avoid paying the "excess weight" fees.  With the case being 25% empty, I have lots of open space in the bag and my belongings bounce around inside.  When I arrive at my destination, I often find my loosely packed belongings out of order and disheveled.  For my next suitcase, I will buy something a tad bit smaller so I can fill 90% or 100%.  When filled to 90-100%, my belongings would be tightly packed and more secure inside.
title: Great Product, but read this IMPORTANT ADVICE if shopping for your first hard suitcase

author: julie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2016
review_content: Samsonite Omni PC Hardside Spinner 20, Caribbean Blue, One Size          My last carry on suitcase served me well for over 12 years, accompanying me on countless trips, usually over-stuffed, through winter weather, through slush and rain and dragged across the cobble-stone streets in Berlin. In the last couple years it began to show it's age, but it wasn't until the handle finally ripped off and the inner lining tore a small hole on my most recent trip that I admitted it was finally time to move on.My initial inclination was to buy something cheap - I don't need fancy luggage, I got student loans to pay... So I was poking around and looking at options in the $30 - $40 market, and there were some that looked ok. But then I would dig into the reviews and read about them breaking on the first trip, or having stuck wheels or finicky handles... Not feeling satisfied I put off the purchase for a while. I went to a store and looked at some of these models in person, and I was startled by how flimsy they felt in person. They were not built to handle the abuse of transatlantic air-travel. Feeling ambivalent, I put off the decision yet again.Fast forward to Tuesday of this week, no suitcase purchased, my flight is Friday morning. I pull my old trusty carry-on out of storage and seriously debate taking it on one last journey... just one more time?? The suitcase does not want. So I come back to Amazon and search again until I find this suitcase. It's not super cheap, but it's not expensive either, and it has a great color, and good reviews, and it sturdy in the photos... I'm still undecided, but, well, clock is ticking, I bite the bullet.Suitcase arrived just in time for my flight :-) My roommate carried the box upstairs for me this afternoon and when I thanked her, commented on how light it was. As soon as I open it I am relieved, this is a strong and sturdy suitcase, and it looks smart. The handle is long, and slides out easily, doesn't rattle around like those other flimsier models did. Wheels are seemingly good quality. The body looks quite durable and scratch resistant, the zipper is good quality, oh and there's even a lock. It holds a lot of stuff for how small it is, and it is expandable which is helpful for people who sometimes overpack.UPDATE: Suitcase held up perfectly over 4 four flights over the holidays, on two of which it actually had to be checked because the flight was very full. Not a single scratch or dent, no signs of wear, and it was easy to travel with - rolled smoothly and easily, sturdy handle.
title: Smart suitcase, looks like it is built to last

author: Anne-Michele L.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2016
review_content: Finally got the chance to use this luggage set.  Just spent nearly a month touring Europe with this set.  We flew to Paris from Chicago.  Then we flew from Paris to Madrid and then from Madrid to Rome.  Then we took trains all over Italy, a cruise throughout Greece and some other stops in Monaco and France.  We carried not only enough clothes for a long trip but we also got married in the Greek Islands so we also had a wedding gown and tux in here as well.  To say that our luggage needed to be spacious, easily maneuverable, and strong enough to bear up to that much travel without wrecking our clothes is an understatement.  We chose Samsonite as my previous set was 16 years old and still going strong.  To see how the all wheel luggage performed we went to a nearby Samsonite store.  The ultra lite series seemed entirely too flimsy for our needs and we decided on this set.  I read all the reviews online and, despite being concerned about the one review I saw about the large bag being beyond regulation size, I ordered this set.  Now on the other side of our trip I can tell you not once did any airline mention the bag's total dimensions (to be honest I've never seen an airline baggage handler with a tape measure and really think they only care if it makes weight) and how many times we discussed during the trip how great this luggage set had performed.  We planned at the start that we would pack without unzipping the 2" extensions to start and would know we had bought enough souvenirs once all three bags had been extended.  It all worked exactly as planned.  The bags were sturdy and well balanced.  We were easily able to put our backpacks and carryon bags on top of these and not need to keep a hold of them to keep them from tipping.  We did get one scratch on the large bag but it is not really noticeable.  Hope this long review helps as I was on the fence from the previous reviews on whether to buy or not and knew I would give this set the great review it deserved once home.
title: Perfect Set for Extended Travel!

review_content: Going to try this one out.Pro's: Super light, Samsonite service is very good, Right size for my needs, Dragger and carry handles look sturdy, good lock, good/simple interior features.Con's: No built in luggage tag,Not sure about: Strength of the exterior shell, Durability of the wheels.I worked for a major airline for 10 years and loaded a lot of bags. In spite of all the BS you see on TV, most airline baggage handlers are as careful as they can be with your bag. title: Looks good - will see. Advice from an ex-airline baggage handler.

author: TKPK Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2018
review_content: I have used this convenient suitcase for 10 trips over the past 6 months. It has served well and is light as advertised. My last trip involved--as usual--rolling it over uneven pavement outdoors. One of the wheels jammed, and the edge was literally flattened due to the friction against the pavement. At my destination, I was able to undo the jam with a screw driver and a lot of elbow grease. Now, I cannot find a way to replace the plastic swivel coaster wheel. This is clearly one of the most vulnerable parts of what would otherwise be a great piece of luggage. I could easily replace it if one were available. Why don't manufacturers offer such parts? $100 is too much to pay for only 6 months of use. Next time I'll look for more durable wheels, from another brand.
title: Can't replace most vulnerable part

author: Chris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2018
review_content: This set of luggage looks nice. But I would not recommend. I just got back from an extended stay in China so I took the big bag. The weight of the packed suitcase was less than the 23kg (50lb) international guideline.  The top luggage handle broke the FIRST time it was lifted onto the airline conveyor belt. I snapped it back into place but it never held for the rest of the trip. It was a pain for the next 3 1/2 weeks to tell every taxi driver, bag handler etc.... that the suitcase needed to be picked up from the side. I will never use this bag again! I just got home from trip and am going to research getting bag replaced or handle repaired.  I am nervous about using the other two bags. Shame on you Samsonite!
title: Flimsy Handle

author: Kt on the go
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2017
review_content: I wish I could give this set 2.5 (a 50%) rating. They seemed durable, the zipper is smooth running, they are really attractive, and the the handles and wheels are great. We bought this set for our honeymoon to Thailand. We felt great with our first set of nice luggage!! After the FIRST use, the smaller carry on sized luggage was dented really, really bad. We had to check it because of weight limits. I tried for an hour with a hairdryer (thanks for the tip, Google) to get the dent out and it looks better, but the dent stopped improving. We understand this is a huge thanks to how the airline handled it, but is still a terrible feeling to spend so much money (for us), only to have junky looking luggage.
title: Huge dent after first use

I traveled to London, Brussels, Munich, back to Brussels, Paris, Rome, Florence, Venice, back to London, Bristol, Bath, London again before returning to LA in a matter of a few weeks. I traveled by plane (checked baggage), train, bus, Uber’s, subway, and on foot. I can proudly say this suitcase is tuff as nails. I really pushed it past it’s limit and then some. It’s survived gravel, cobblestone roads, and even being dragged up and down stairs by the handle (I know, I know, you’re not SUPPOSED to do that) and it survived without a scratch on the suitcase itself. Which wouldn’t bother me anyway. They’re like a sign of being well travelled, but I digress. The wheels are scratched up, but that’s about it. Lastly, towards the middle through the end of my trip, I tied a duffle bag with a luggage bungee cord (also purchased on Amazon) which just added more weight. The suitcase did not fall over. I highly recommend these suitcases! It’s a great investment.——These just arrived so I’ll update my review after my upcoming trip to Europe. Let me preface this review by saying I’ve only owned the old fashioned fabric suitcases with wheels. My motivation for ordering a more hard shell set of suit cases was for some type of protection against the rain. My last two trips to Central America and Europe were not great. On several occasions my fabric suit cases got soaked in the rain and so did all my stuff.Any who, I did a lot of research before picking this set. I was leaning towards the Amazon brand because I can be cheap, but these had such great reviews. I figured the extra bucks were worth it. I wanted the Caribbean Blue so bad. It looks gorgeous in the photos! But I’m cheap so I ordered black. Still gorgeous.It rolls fine even on carpet so I expect it will survive cobblestone roads. The hard shell case looks protective, but then again I understand it not impenetrable. I expect it will likely get scratches, but that’s the price you pay for frequent travel.I had read other reviews about some annoying plastic on each suitcase. Either it varies by seller or perhaps several sellers have now listened and made changes. Unpacking was simple. It arrived as expected and on time. Each individual suit case was simply wrapped in a plastic bag, similar to a dry cleaners. Then they were stacked into each other similar to Russian dolls. It arrived in one box.My only complaint is there were no instructions for setting up the locks. I had to search for a video on YouTube. I went ahead and posted a video with my review. Hopefully it’s helpful!Thankfully, I have yet to have an issue with getting my luggage mixed up at the carousel so that’s not a concern even now. But I’ll still secretly thing of the Caribbean Blue I was too cheap to pay for.I purchased these for an upcoming trip to Europe later this month so I’ll definitely provide an update once I’m back in October.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2017
review_content: I’ve owned Ssmsonite products for years and have always felt it was a name I could trust.  That said, I was disappointed with this product.  It was sturdy enough and survived a three week European trip intact.  However, it was very difficult to maneuver.  My wife and I each had one of these suitcases and found that they were difficult to keep moving in one direction.  They kept veering off in random directions and required a real fight to keep them tracking along side us.  I finally found that I had to pull the bag along behind me as I would with a conventional roller bag to keep moving comfortably forward which defeats the purpose of having a spinner roller bag.  Our bags were each 50 lbs plus, but that should not cause these bags to be so difficult to maneuver. And when the surface was not smooth forget it.  These bags were impossible to manage.  Needless to say both my wife and I were very disappointed with our purchases.

author: Momma Hen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2020
review_content: We bought the Samsonite Omni PC Hardside Expandable Luggage with Spinner Wheels, Caribbean Blue.  The listed manufacturers measurements ARE NOT as described: "Product Dimensions 28.5 x 20.5 x 13.5 inches"  If this were true then it would pass check in at 62.5.  The airlines require 62 with a 2" allowance.  The manufacturer listed the "packing measurements" for the bag instead of the needed "overall measurement" on the listing for the 3 pc I bought.  To find the TRUE measurements I had to go to the listing that sells that bag individually.  There the manufacturer lists the 28" bag as...Overall Dimensions: 30.5" x 21.5" x 13.5" , Weight: 10.35 pounds.  That will total 65.5" and puts THIS BAG 3.5" OVER which will cost me an EXTRA $150 to use! I contacted Amazon to return it and they told me I was unable to return it since it had been 30 days.  These bags are still in the box they were mailed in! This is wrong and they should be required to take it back because they misrepresented what was being sold! My family won't have enough bags for travel now... THANKS!!** I can't accurately rate it on sturdiness and durability yet.  I can update it once we return while using the 2 smaller bags.
title: Misrepresented measurements on the 28" will COST ME AN ADDITIONAL $150 TO USE!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2016
review_content: Items got here quick. The set looks great. It's built very well and sturdy. The wheels roll nice and smooth. The 28 I was able to get 70 lbs in it. The 24 got 43 lbs. The 20- the carry on fits prefect in the over head. The carry on, I think is the best item. When walking down the those tiny aisle on the plane, you don't have to carry it at all. The four spinner wheels roll nice and smooth when getting on or off the plane, especially if you have a lot of stuff.
title: Great set. Holds a lot of stuff. Love the carry on.

author: Farm wife
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2017
review_content: Took it on a business trip with my husband to Florida and I loved it. It pulled easily in every direction and never got hung up on anything, even in the parking lot. One thing I really liked was that both sides are the same size - I put pants and heavier things on the bottom and found I could put shirts and blouses on the other side and it seemed like everything packed better than in all my other regular suitcases. The top side has a mesh cover that zips over everything - I liked that. The size was just right - did some shopping while there and got everything in without having to use the expandable zipper coming home! There is a moderate amount of "give" between the two sides after it's zipped, even without using the third zipper to let things out more. And the color is just so pretty! It was the only teal hardsider on the baggage carousels every time!
title: Holds a lot, pulls smoothly, looks pretty

author: hypnotherapist
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2021
review_content: Great suitcase!  My laptop is really heavy so I use it as a combination computer carry case and overnight bag.However, I spent several hours with customer support at both Amazon and Samsonite trying to get it registered for the limited warranty. None of them knew where the information for registering the suitcase is for this model. Contrary to the Samsonite instructions, it is not in or on the suitcase and it does not contain letters.  The information is on the label on the box. (See the photo.) It is not identified as information to register.  The label is white with black text and is 6.5" long and 2" tall. Directly under OMNI PC, the five numbers on the left are the SKU# and the four numbers after the dash are the color numbers. You also need the UPC number which is on the far right of the same label. You can see just the beginning of the UPC number in the photo. Don't know if this applies to other models or not; just know it worked for this one.
title: This is where you will find the information to register for the warranty on this model.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2017
review_content: Bought this suitcase in November of '16 and have used it to travel once a month since then.  The shell has held up well but the handle and wheels are a different story.  The handle has gradually become looser and looser.  About 2 months ago it was getting harder to push the suitcase in the upright position and I noticed that the wheels on the handle side where getting really worn out.  During my trip last week one of the front wheels completely seized up and now has melted into a square, see the pics. Very disappointed in the durability of this suitcase, thought the Samsonite name would come with a little higher quality.UPDATE - changed this to one star because Samsonite doesn't carry any replacement parts for this piece.  Have to mail to a repair shop at my cost and hope they see it as a defect to get it fixed.  Then get to wait weeks for it to be returned.  Huge waste of money!
title: WHEELS ARE HORRIBLE.  DON'T BUY IF YOU WANT A SUITCASE THAT LASTS LONGER THAN A YEAR.

author: Lisa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2017
review_content: I cannot believe my luggage fell apart on my first trip. I wonder whether it has any wanrranty from samsonite.
title: I cannot believe my luggage fell apart on my first ...

author: Michelle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2018
review_content: This arrived completely as advertised, so I can't complain about that, and after an initial trip cross-country with the bag, it so far appears to have the expected Samsonite high-quality production. However, I don't know if i'd purchase a hard-sided piece of luggage for my carry on next time, as although it fit perfectly in the overhead bin, there's no ability to make it fit when overhead space is limited like a soft-sided bag would. It's also impractical if you want to open it to get out a jacket or other small item, as I felt like I had to unzip it almost completely. Again, this isn't a flaw in the product's design (it's meant to operate the way it does), but I could quickly see why these types of suitcases seem far more suited for checked baggage than carry ons.One plus to the hardsided bag was that it served as a great stand for my purse and stood much more easily in all situations than other soft-sided bags I have.
title: Completely as advertised, but consider your needs

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2018
review_content: WARNING The suitcase in the picture is not the suitcase you will receive. The suitcase in the picture has a handle on the side by the TSA locks. The suitcase you will receive does not have a side handle. This is a major annoyance if you are a road warrior and use this regularly. I've used mine three or four nights a week for the last five weeks with lots more travel to come.That said it is sturdy (so far) with good wheels and it is light weight. With a good set of packing cubes I can take it out for a week.And the price is right if it holds up.But I really miss that extra handle!
title: That said it is sturdy (so far) with good wheels and it is light ...

author: Jay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2017
review_content: Got these for the wife who needed a new set of luggage.  She wanted better wheels and spinners than the last set we got 5-7 years ago and no more soft-sided luggage as we fly a lot and they got really beat up.  So far all have been used and work great.  The only thing she doesn't like is the zipped section for the one side doesn't have pockets bit it does have a zippered pouch on the inside which is nice.  The built in locks work great. have had no issues with them so far.  Will try to do an update in 6-12 monthsUPDATE: Three months after we got this set, the handle on the large piece came off while lifting off luggage rack, was at 45lbs.  Too late to return.  Also the smallest piece only has a handle on top, not on site.  The Ricardo set I got at Costco is made better and was half the cost.
title: After three months handle broke

author: LLM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2017
review_content: Bought this for a recent trip (flights and cruise) which required a lot of baggage checking and handling.  Suitcase looks brand new upon our return.  The "dimpled" surface reduces marks and scars as advertised.  Color is beautiful, not too bright, just rich looking.  Easy to pack, and nice quality.  We added a two-way baggage strap (BlueCosto (Black) Heavy Duty Long Cross Luggage Strap Suitcase Travel Belt Non-slip 600001-BLK)  to add to security, stability, and aid in easy identification at baggage claim. Lightweight which gives you an opportunity to pack more stuff or souvenirs.  Rolls easily.  Very happy with the purchase.
title: Excellent suitcase!

author: Christine Sudmalis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2018
review_content: I would not recommend.  Small suitcase which I use regularly barely rolls and with laptop bag on top does not roll at all.  Larger suitcases which I use less frequently are in good shape but use them once a month vs weekly.  Very disappointed with smallest bag and it’s duability.
title: I would not recommend. Small suitcase which I use regularly barely rolls ...

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2018
review_content: Used it once, zipper of the two suitcases already broke. Price stiff and quality of material is poor.
title: Price stiff and quality of material is poor.

author: Art Solis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2020
review_content: When you call their 1-800 customer service number, it's a recording saying there is a high volume of calls and will give you an email to send your info to, and then the call hangs up on you.The reply back from Samsonite is they'll get back to you within 7 business days. What a crock! They're not going to have my luggage fixed within two weeks... they're going to get "back to me within two weeks!"I've bought luggage at half the price and it's lasted 4x's longer! And when it did break, that manufacturer mailed me a new one with a return label the same week!Never again with Samsonite.
title: Buy cheaper, it'll last longer

author: Pumpkin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2018
review_content: Pros: This set is very economical, lightweight, attractive and low profile. Each size holds a lot especially if you're a strategic packer. I even was able to take a trip with just the smallest size for one month spent in three climates.Cons: I take 100-150+ flights a year but can count on one hand the amount of times I check a bag. That being said, the physical damage my carry-on has endured despite never checking it is very surprising especially given my set is less than a year old. Two of the wheels are now damaged, one of which barely spins anymore, so it's become very difficult to push or pull the suitcase. Lastly, the handles are very shaky and fragile. I really regret not investing a bit more in a Tumi or Rimowa instead.Conclusion: if you're looking for an attractive but inexpensive luggage set to use for your infrequent vacations, this set should be ok. If you live on an airplane, don't waste your money and time with this lump of cheap plastic. Just. don't.
title: Frequent flyers stay away!!

author: jack taylor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2017
review_content: Nice set of suitcases.  The teal colour is very nice blue/green blend, pretty close to what you see in Amazon's pic, not on the Samsonite page.  The color on the Samsonite page isn't as accurate, looks a lot darker than it actually is.  The large suitcase is just that, LARGE!  Easy to get overweight with that one pretty quickly and it's pretty tough to lift with the size and weight if you fill it up.  Surface is also very slippery, which doesn't help with lifting - your hands will just slide off if you're trying to stabilize it from the side or underneath.  Handles are a bit too small for the large suitcase, could have used something a bit more substantial.  Large suitcase on its own weighs around 10.35 lbs (according to Samsonite website. 10.5 according to my fishing scale), medium is 8.3, small one is 6.8lbs.  Quite a bit lighter than our old fabric suitcases.  The medium suitcase is a great intermediate size, I'll be using that one a lot.  Haven't used the small one, but we did see them being used as carry on during a couple of flights.Wheels roll really easily.  We'll see how they last.They are also getting popular.  Quite a few showed up on the baggage carousels, so you'll want to personalize them with some ribbon or stickers.Overall, very please with them.
title: Very nice set of suitcases, good price.

author: denise:)
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2018
review_content: I ordered the Samsonite Omni 24" in the metallic plum color - i have the carry on size of this hardside spinner and love it, so it was a no brainer to order the bigger sized as a checked bag for an up coming 3 week trip to Europe with varying weather conditions.In addition to this bag, i ordered a Hadaki Hampton tote in Daisy Delight to coordinate as my carry on- these look lovely together so much so that i haven't put them away yet- i want to keep looking at them!!I did research hardside, 24-26" spinners before choosing Samsonite Omni. It's hard to decide but i went with Samsonite Omni because i already had the carry on (only realized this as i was researching) and also because it was the lightest one in the reviews at 8lbs.  This means more weight for packing!  The handle and wheels work great on the carry on size, and so far, in my house, the same goes for the 24".  I have checked my carry on size previously and it held up well with the luggage loading/unloading and abuse behind the scenes so I'm assuming the Omni 24" will survive likewise.This case has an expandable zipper and the only downside to this bag (which i imagine might be the case for any  larger sized, hardside, clamshell case that expands) is that if it's heavy, you may have some wiggle between the sides as you maneuver on uneven pavement, or if you're lifting it.  There isn't a handle on the bottom, which is also not great.  But otherwise, the case fits enough clothes for a three week trip (if you're not a diva and packing 15 pairs of shoes, lol).  I generally bring 2-3 pairs of shoes (wearing my biggest shoes on the travel days) and will wash clothes when i travel that long.  We will also mail back dirty clothes so purchases can be packed instead.
title: You can do anything with the right shoes and the right luggage...

author: The_Phantom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2018
review_content: This 28" version and it's 20" companion have been taken on planes to the Philippines round trip twice now and have shown no signs of wear and tear.  We are very pleased with this purchase and would definitely recommend it for long trips.  The wheels and handle make them very easy to maneuver in the airport, which is great 'cause we all know how stressful a crowded airport can be.
title: Round Trip Overseas twice and still going strong

author: Michael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2017
review_content: I have been extremely happy with this purchase.  I researched many suitcases for a 2 week trip to Europe this summer and ultimately decided on this case (that was also purchased with the 20" case that was not brought to Europe).It held up extremely well through 3 flights, many walks through the streets from train station to hotel, and on a few train rides.  You can tell there are little "scratches" or marks where something hit it, but no major discoloration or punctures (to date).  There is a ton of room and if you need a little more it has the expanding zipper.  The wheels were a large concern of mine since that was the reason for my new suitcase purchase, old cheap suitcase where the wheels fell out of shape.  The fact that this has 4 360' spinning wheels is great when you need to drag it behind you on 2 wheels or guide it easily though a flat surface (train station or airport) with all 4 wheels down and the handle has different levels for whether or not you're using 2 or 4 wheels.The 24" suitcase has 2 handles, one on top and 1 on the side.  They have some give which is nice, but I think I will always worry about them snapping since the suitcase, when full, can weigh a lot.  I had it around 36 lbs for my international flights and 33 for domestic and they have not broken, so neither I or the airlines have managed to break them despite the weight and the airlines typical lack of "handle with care" for suitcases.When opened, the right half has 2 elastic straps to help keep things in place and from shifting around and the left half has the mesh zipper that keeps the stuff on that side from falling out when opening the suitcase.  There is even a long skinny zipper pouch to put smaller stuff, receipts, etc. inside.  The suitcase itself is extremely lightweight and does not add much weight at all, if you're concerned about potentially going over the 50 lbs limit.I would highly recommend this suitcase and plan on having it for many years.  It has held up through several other domestic flights as well and I have no reason to worry when using them in the future.
title: Highly Recommend This Suitcase

author: David Clifford
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2021
review_content: Needed new luggage, my old samsonite suitcases have been around the world dozens of times and held up well, so I I *thought* it would be a good idea to stick with the established brand.Well, im sad to report it looks like another former "quality product" is trading on their established nameand manufacturing cheap products. this suitcase did not survive the first leg of its first journey.the carry handle broke when loading it into the taxi trunk in europe. The bag weighed 47.4 pounds whichis 2.6 pounds under the airline restriction. the product is flimsy. if you hid the samsonite logo, andexamined the case, you would probably assume it was cheap made in china, flea-market quality junk.when it first arrived I thought to my self, either this is total crap, or samsonite has pulled out all thestops and used NASA tech to bring a high quality lightweight product to market.Broke on the first trip tell you everything you need to know.
title: Its poorly constructed

author: Tracey H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2019
review_content: I purchased this summer of 2017.  I’m writing this review now because my luggage has finally taken its last breath and I need to find a new one.  I imagine that after 2 years with about 8 trips, lugging this bad boy across airport parking lots, and especially being tossed around by TSA, I’ve gotten my money’s worth.Now, the structure of the bag is 100% in tact.  The parts that have given out are the TSA lock and especially the poor wheels.  It’s impossible to trolley around at this point since 2 of the wheels are stripped.All in all, this is a great piece of luggage and will protect your items very well during travel.
title: After 2 years, my luggage has gone kaput

author: Linda B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2021
review_content: Before I purchased this suitcase, I read the poorer reviews to see what the complaints are.  The zippers seemed to be the worst so I looked at the suitcase ergonomically.  The red zipper is for making the suitcase wider so it can be zipped easier.  Once I unzipped the red one and pulled upwards on the upper part of the suitcase, the black zippers closed with little to no effort at all.The suitcase rolled very well through the airport and came through baggage handling without a scratch.  I put a brightly colored zip tie in the handle space so my suitcase was easy to identify as it came through baggage claim.Overall, I'm satisfied and would recommend this piece of luggage.
title: Good product

author: Mom of 3
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2019
review_content: I purchased two of these for an overseas trip. The limit for luggage weight was 50 pounds, so nothing too heavy. We weighed it and the packed bag weighed 45.3 pounds. When we arrived in Europe, it was still in one piece. But when my husband went to pick it up, the handle just broke off.I am so disappointed because the Samsonite brand has always been my go-to for travel. They USED to make quality products. These were light and cheaply made. And they were not cheap. To top it off, we were gone for several weeks so the return period has passed. I am stuck with one broken bag that wasn’t even whole for the trip back and one that will probably break on my next trip. My advice is to stay away from this specific bag.
title: Did not last ONE trip

author: Melanie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2017
review_content: Took these to Europe for two weeks and they endured planes, trains, and cobblestone streets. They held up well. They're pretty roomy and you can fit a lot into them but I do wish that both sides had the mesh zipper closure to keep things in place. When you open it you want to have the mesh panel on top because the other side has only an elastic strap to keep things in place. Unfortunately, I could never figure out a way to determine which side was which just by looking at the outside of the bag so every time I opened it, it was a gamble on whether or not half of my clothing would fall out. But other than that, these are nice bags. I got the teal color and it's really a lovely color. You can't tell from the website but it's like an iridescent color not unlike a bottle fly.
title: They're pretty roomy and you can fit a lot into them ...

author: Donna Symons
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2021
review_content: Much larger than I thought. Purchased because airline broke my suitcase, and needed a new one to return home. So large we put my husband’s inside and came home with just one checked bag. The color is much brighter than I expected. My husband hates the color, but it’s my bag so oh well! 😂
title: Strong, moves easily! Tons of room

author: Miracle Man
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2020
review_content: Only 3 stars for this because of the lock issue. The case came with no lock instructions at all. And one of the zippers was locked. Checked the reviews, doing a search for lock instructions and found the following one. Wow! Worked great! Press a pen tip in the tiny hole on the edge closest to the zipper. Thanks Chris G!"Lock instructions for this suitcase are incorrect. DO NOT follow the instructions that it comes with, you'll waste a ton of time trying to correct Samsonite's mistake. While set to 000 (or previously set code), press the hidden button with a pen or pencil tip, then release. Set to your desired code and then OPERATE THE OPENING MECHANISM to lock in the code. Again, opening the lock sets the code. Now you can randomize the digits to lock it. The included instructions do not state any of this, so you might end up opening the lock on random digits and setting to an undesired code."
title: Setting the combination lock

author: outdoor lover
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2021
review_content: My husband and I take trips averaging 4 nights and we've always packed a large suitcase for the two of us but have always hated waiting for it at baggage claim.  We were given a carry on by a relative and decided to purchase this and hope the two combined would hold all of our items.  I was skeptical, but VERY  pleased with how much it was able to hold and how easy it was to maneuver and lift.  (It blew away the one given to us.)  We also have the option to expand it further, but it was not needed on this trip.  It's nice looking and held up well during travel.  For our needs it's the perfect fit, and being able to walk through the airport and just walk out is amazing!
title: Holds more than I thought it would!

author: Michael Burgos
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021
review_content: Great case! I love the look of it. The post for the pull out handle are thick and feel extremely durable. (The ones one my last luggage was flimsy and bent) The wheels are smooth as butter.The lock works great but took a minute to figure out. There is a push button you have to push in with a pen tip or something skinny. It was not in the same position on the actual lock as it was in the picture. After you push the pin in, you set the combo to your desired number. Then you have to push the pin again until it pops out. Then the new combo is set. My pen tip was too wide to get down far enough to get the pin back out so I used a nail. Overall it was easy enough.Love this case and I’m looking forward to getting a lot of use out of it.
title: Durable, sharp looking, quality luggage.

author: nadia turchetta
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2018
review_content: I travel a lot and I’ve purchased many suitcases over the years. This is by far the worst suitcase I have ever purchased despite the reviews all been very positive. After a couple of months the wheels started to clog. When I called customer service given that it’s supposed to be under warranty, they kept trying to get out of it .  If I want to ship it to get repaired, I have to pay for shipment. The alternative is for me to drive an hour to bring it to a repair center that may or may not agree that it’s warranty work .  This is a carry-on suitcase. I have never checked in and I take really good care of it so for them to tell me that it’s not warranty work is complete BS.
title: Bad quality  and even worst customer service

author: JamieOM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2019
review_content: I just got these and have used them for one flight so far. I am currently injured and had to be pushed around in a wheelchair. The people that assisted me were able to push my carry on as well as me with relative ease. They were even able to push me and my carry on plus the bigger suitcase (the smaller one was inside of it) all at the same time because they were able to roll together so easily.The material moves enough to allow for stuffing a lot in, but seems quite durable. There is also the option of unzipping the expansion if needed. Just be sure to check your weight. They hold so much, I could see if being easy to over load them and not even realize it.I had to use the carry on to elevate my foot with a big boot on. I had to throw it a around a lot due to lack of movement (on my part) and had that boot moving all over it. I haven’t noticed any scratches. Nor have I noticed any on the larger suitcase. They all fit inside of each other for storage which is very nice. They seem worth the little bit of extra money to get this great quality product.  I’m very happy with these!
title: Awesome luggage! I’m glad I decided to spend a little more than planned for this great quality.

author: Chris Brooks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2021
review_content: Was going on a mini vacation with the Mrs. and needed a carry-on bag because we were only going for a few days. I knew I wanted hard sided luggage. I knew I wanted 360 spinners, easy to maneuver and lightweight. Because there are SOOOOOO many choices I wanted a brand that in my opinion have been in the game long enough and had a good reputation for quality. My color choices were purple, green or silver. Oh, a plus would be if it was expandable. This bag checked ALL the boxes! Took it on it's maiden voyage this past weekend on a trip to Chicago and it passed with flying colors! Easy maneuverability over different terrains, telescoping handle worked fine, AND had no problems setting the combo on the TSA lock.On the trip back bought some souvenirs to pack so I had to expand the suitcase and everything fit just fine and was easy to close with minimum strain. Because I had to expand it and it had bottles a water, juice etc. so I had to check my bag. When I went to baggage claim to get my bag, came through unscathed! Love this bag will definitely get the larger one for the longer trips. Definitely a good investment and the price was reasonable compared to other bags with similar qualities
title: The Name Speaks for itself

author: Simple is Best
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2021
review_content: I purchased the 3 pieces set because the 29" expandable was not available by itself in the color I wanted in the time I needed it.  I was surprised at how light this suitcase is and also, being so big, easy to handle.  I was able to fit everything I needed and still had plenty of room without having to expand it.  I feel that if you expand such a big suitcase, it may become less stable and harder to move around.  Keep in mind that these wonderful spinner wheels are made to run smoothly only on airport surfaces - no rugs, or sidewalks.  I had a slightly more difficult time rolling it from the parking lot to the terminal as the road surfaces are rougher and less even.  Aside from that, it makes a world of a difference to use a spinner rather than the traditional 2 wheeled suitcases.  I own a fabric Travel Pro set that is in very good shape and I have used for many years but it has 2 wheels and it is much heavier - so time to upgrade.  I am happy with  my purchase.  As far as the dimensions, I don't know who took them - I was worried that the 29 inch would be too big and I would have to pay over size charges but NOPE.  I  measured it right out of the box and the overall dimensions including the wheels was 61 inches (length + width + height) which is under the 62" maximum required by the airlines.  I packed stuff for 8 days and even though I was allowed 70 lb. in my checked baggage, I was only at 62 lbs.  The weight of the suitcase itself is a big help.  I did see a few superficial scratches on it, only after the first trip, but it is to be expected.  I am not worried about scratches - they are inevitable - in my opinion.  So with that said, I will most likely end up buying another set for my husband.  The carryon is also the perfect size and I was pleasantly surprised at how much stuff I can fit in it.  I used to to stuff all the heavy goodies I bought abroad, including liquids, and I checked it as a regular bag.  The medium 25" is a good size - no so medium - more like a large suitcase but I have not used it yet.  I believe the 25" is most likely going to be my clothing suitcase and the larger one will be the everything else and souvenir b ag - as it holds tons of stuff.  Very happy with my purchase.
title: Lightweight and easily versatile

author: D. Irwin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2016
review_content: I purchased this suitcase to transport a large bulky costume in. The costume fit just fine since this case is quite large.Unfortunately, on the return journey of the first aircraft trip I took the polycarbonate side was cracked open and water leaked in and damaged items of mine.I expect rough treatment by airlines but I feel that either I got extremely unlucky or this suitcase isn't up to muster thanks to the quest for minimal weight. I would expect a hard-side case to last through more than one instance of abuse? People buy hard-side cases to protect their items and I don't feel like you can be confident in this suitcase after my incident.
title: Lightweight, but not durable

author: AV Guy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2021
review_content: I purchased Omni PC Hardside suitcases for my recent trip.  The 28" Omni PC Hardside had a wheel failure before I even completed my first flight to Greece.  The luggage was great (distinctive color and scratch resistant exterior) but the wheels were not.  The rubber part just peeled off the wheel, making the whole thing almost unusable.  Spent the next 5 weeks of my vacation carrying a 50lb suitcase because it wouldn't roll.  I did effect a repair using some epoxy that I purchased from an auto store in Albania, and it held, but it wasn't a perfect repair.  I've submitted a warranty complaint to Samsonite and I have yet to hear back.  Learn from my mistake.  Whatever suitcase that you buy, make sure they have good wheels, preferably ones that look like rollerblade wheels I'm guessing.  Having a two piece wheel, rubber glued on to plastic, seems like a cheap failure point.  Rollerblade wheels are one piece are meant to take abuse and are readily replaceable.  The wheels on my luggage are not.  Also, if you have spinner wheels, make sure that you only roll your luggage in the upright, vertical position.  Pulling spinner luggage at an angle, like traditional luggage, may have accelerated my bag's wheel failure.  Just a thought for those of you that are new to spinner wheel luggage.  Also, in the future, I will try to travel with a spare wheel for my big bag, because a wheel failure on a 50 lb bag of luggage is not an option.  Update:  Have spent weeks trying to get Samsonite to respond to my wheel failure.  This is the worst company in the world.  Do NOT buy this product!!!
title: Terrible Suitcase - wheels broke after first use.  Samsonite is the worst company to deal with!

author: Roger Taylor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2021
review_content: This suitcase got me through a 7-day cruise but only because I told the luggage handler I had breakables inside so he wouldn't throw it or stack other luggage on top.  This suitcase is actually quite fragile and too light to be as durable and rugged as described.  It appears to be plastic with a super thin metal? screen shell for decoration.  The inside has no means of separating your items.  It's just one big hollow box which was a major turnoff for me.  There's no way to hang a dress shirt or slacks, either.  With the amount of clothes this thing will hold it feels like it's going to break a wheel or something under the weight.  Sure, it looks appealing on the outside, but I expected more for the high price.  Sorry, Samsonite, this is the kind of reviews you can expect when aiming for profit instead of quality.
title: Don't let a luggage handler touch it

author: Blue Leaves
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2021
review_content: I’ve had this suitcase for a year now, and it’s been great. I travel 2 weeks out of the month, usually via carpool, so it does get some abuse. It gets hauled up and down stairs, thrown in the back of a truck, smashed by other luggage, etc. Its held up well. It only has minor scuff marks to the bottom surface where it scraped against rough concrete. The wheels work well, and spin in all directions easily. Both handles are heavily used and still intact. The telescoping handle works smoothly and makes life easy.I find this size (20”) works very well for me for a week long trip. I typically pack the following: a week’s worth of underclothes, a pair of pjs, 1-2 pair of shoes (usually flats or sandals), 4-6 outfits, maybe some accessories and two large toiletry bags that have everything else in them. In the warmer months I don’t usually have to use the expander function, but in the warmer months with bulkier clothes, I do.I have the purple color, which is nice and subtle, since these are mostly professional trips. Everyone else has black bags, so I wanted mine to be a little easier to identify without being too bright.I would call this a “soft” hard-side suitcase. It’s pliable and probably could dent in the right situation. However, I like the way it looks and feels.Overall, it has worked well for me and I will be looking to purchase more from this line and brand.
title: My Regular Traveling Companion

author: Christine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
review_content: I love this little carry-on! I've used it for two international trips and I'm really liking it. I used this for a 10-day trip to Italy, and I was able to get through the entire trip with just this carry-on and one regular-sized backpack. Other folks in the tour group (a tour group that we didn't know we'd be a part of... lol) were lugging around GIANT suitcases on small trains and over cobblestone streets, and I was breezing around with this little wonder. It was so great.Pros: PERFECT size for all international carry-on regulations! I was able to carry this onto to all of my international flights and fit it into the overhead compartments easily. The locking mechanism is really nice and easy to use! I also love how lightweight it is, and how much space is inside. I can easily lift and maneuver it with one hand and still have a hand free.  It also has a little zipper compartment on the inside that is great for smaller items, like keys or medication. It's held up super well and will continue to hold up it seems. It's showing very few signs of wear or tear, even after two long trips with a lot of flights and handling.Cons: There is no handle on the side, so it makes it kind of difficult to load an unload from trunks or overhead bins, or to pick it up from a baggage carousel in case it has to get checked. The wheels also aren't as great as I would've hoped. They sometimes catch or get stuck when I'm rolling sideways. It's very minor, but still can be annoying when I'm in a hurry at the airport.Overall, I'm super pleased at the quality and value! I also love the dark blue color so much. It's beautiful!
title: Best Carry-On I've Owned!

author: RoqC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2018
review_content: Received my new set of OMNI PC Samsonite luggage set. Not the material I expected but still very nice. All outside zippers run smoothly. I love that one section inside the case zips closed and goes over all your clothes. I’m going to rate this a 4 Star for now and after our trip, I’ll review to give an update on how it held up. Overall, I’m happy with my purchase.Well, I’m back from vacation. I must say overall, my 3 piece luggage set held up very nicely. The only thing was when we picked up my luggage, we noticed the zipper open. Not sure if it’s due to transit on aircraft or a flaw in the design. But I will say, when we got home, it zipped back up perfectly. Now I’m just keeping my fingers crossed for the next use. I’ll keep my review at a 4 Star.
title: beautiful inside and out, fully functional

author: Joya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2017
review_content: I was initially thrilled to get this suitcase because the color is amazing, it's lightweight and glides around easily. But after just one use the wheel broke! There are rubber rings around each wheel and it wore down and fell off. It was a pretty easy trip so I was disappointed... I know spinner wheels are much more likely to break and are expensive and a pain to fix, so I was looking specifically for one with good wheels. This was not it. It also scuffs and stains quite easily.It was the first time I bought a hardside suitcase. I thought it would be cool and possibly neater to pack stuff on both sides, but that was poor planning on my part. In a small hotel room when it's perched on a suitcase holder, you have to keep it packed and shut. You cannot keep it open unless you have enough room on the floor for both sides to be open, unless the stuff in the top part is securely stored and zipped in. Whereas with a soft suitcase you can just unzip the top of it and keep it open.
title: Wheel broke immediately

author: Reuben Kanhai
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2016
review_content: The best and most versatile bags there is. We went on a 30 day trip to India to many states and the design on this is number one. Its twin the Winfield which we also bought was a disaster. So much damage due to the material not being able to handle international travel in planes.
title: The best and most versatile bags there is

author: PeteEd
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2019
review_content: This bag was perfect for my recent two week travel to Lisbon, Rome, Bari, and London. I took it on six air flight segments, three trains, and four car rides, so it did get a good work out being loaded and unloaded several times. One thing I noticed on the train was that when you put this in the luggage compartment, like all bags with these spinner wheels, it would slip out unless there was a lip on the bottom of the compartment. On the Leonardo Express from Rome's airport to the Termini station, for example, a couple of turns resulted in this heavier bag pushing out two other carry on bags into the aisle. Solution: Lay it flat if there is no barrier to it rolling out.It held a deceptively large amount of clothes and other items (gifts, toiletry bag, electronic cables, documents, etc.) without the need for expansion. I used compression bags (the ones where you press out the air) for 14 days worth of shirts, underwear, and socks, and also was able to pack two pairs of pants, an extra pair of shoes, a rain jacket, two t-shirts, and a pair of casual pants, as well as the other items listed above. It met the check-in weight requirements of European airlines easily.The locking mechanism was excellent and easy to use. The only time my bag was opened was when I landed back in the US and it was unlocked when I retrieved it. Interestingly, when TSA used their key to open the bag, it reset the combination to show the code I used; I just didn't expect that to happen.The only complaint I have is with how this bag performed on less than smooth flat surfaces. Taking the bag across paved roads and on the sidewalk was fine; however, cobble stone streets, any rough surfaces (even slightly rough), and carpeted hallways were more difficult to negotiate; I had to tilt the bag and drag it, instead of having it upright on all four wheel sets. My carry-on bag, in contrast, had no problem so it was either how this bag's wheels were configured or the extra weight that made it more challenging. This was all more of an inconvenience than a major issue with the bag.
title: Strong bag, some issues on uneven ground

author: Juline K. Lambert
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2021
review_content: I was out of town too long to return or I would have. The are sturdy and nice looking. However, the wheels suck. They are very hard to push around on anything but the slickest airport floor! I am going to have Ebro point for replacement wheels I guess and not happy about it. The largest one is also TOO large for any airline weight limits any longer unless you are packing feathers.
title: Wish I could return

author: Nathan Groom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2021
review_content: I got this as travel resumed with my company.  I love everything about it for air travel and road travel. I am able to place my laptop, several outfits and shoes, etc. We even used it for a family trip and got my outfits and my wife's outfits in here for several days without a problem.  The only thing that could be improved would be a stronger handle.  I feel when you are "walking" it along side of you, versus pulling it from behind, that hotel carpets make it difficult to "walk"...not impossible but the reason I got this with spinner wheels was for the way you can walk it.
title: Great for travel!

author: Brian S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2021
review_content: Just got back from our first vacation with the new luggage and so far, Denver to Vegas to Maui and back and very happy with the purchase! I was having a hard time finding luggage that checked all the boxes for me. Some I didn’t like the design, some didn’t have locks, others I liked but the prices seemed higher than I wanted to spend, others were lighter on the wallet but I didn’t know the brand well. These hit the right spot for me so I took the chance and ordered them. I really like the simple styling and they are available in a wide range of colors! The lock works great and was easy to set to my own code. Wheels roll nice and smooth and handle pops up and down smoothly. I packed my large piece to 45 pounds and used the small one as a carry on. They are nice and light when empty so they give you a good amount of weight to play with for checked baggage. Handles and wheels held up perfectly well and came home with no more than a scuff on the large bag that I can probably just scrub off. Highly recommended if you’re in the market for a nice three piece set that looks good and performs well and won’t break the bank!
title: Solid set at a great price

author: Aaron Johnson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2021
review_content: I’m not going to lie. These were a lot more  expensive than other options available with the exact same features, but I bought this because I liked the color better.I got a two piece luggage set for $200 while my partner got a 3 piece for half the price. Same exact lock mechanism, just different branding and a few cosmetic changes. The overall quality is the exact same.That being said, this is a nice set if you can afford it. It’s lightweight, the wheels glide very easily over surfaces, and the hard shell is thick enough to avoid crumbling in under weight.The lock was a bit of a pain to set as I accidentally set it wrong the first time. I had to find a YouTube video on how to break into the lock.. so keep in mind it’s not fully thief proof. It is quite tricky to hack though.
title: Good budget suitcase

author: Lynnie C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2021
review_content: I have never owned a nice set of luggage. Only the $30 three-piece sets from Target. But in my senior year's, I am planning on some hefty trips and decided that it was finally time for some “real” luggage. I did a LOT of research on brands and sets, and this one seemed to come out pretty well. The largest piece is enormous to me, but is still lightweight, and all three pieces spin well on their wheels. The color is my favorite! I'm looking forward to many happy memories being made with them in tow!
title: Finally! Real Luggage!

author: Alice
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2017
review_content: Got the luggage for an international trip. This is not my first samsonite luggage and won’t be the last. I like how lightweight it is and sturdy. The non-scratch surface is pretty good but honestly, unless your luggage is made out of diamond, it will get scratches no matter what. I am okay with it as long as it doesn’t look horrible.The luggage is easy to clean. I always clean my checked bags because who knows what’s in the cargo area! The hard shell makes it possible to clean thoroughly and dry fast.Fast shipping and no issue at all.
title: Not my first and not my last

author: Barb E.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2021
review_content: We ordered the set of 3. We originally ordered what looked like a champagne color and they were a blaaa grey. We returned those and ordered red thinking it would be a dark red. They are more of a fire engine red and shiny, but we kept them anyway even though we weren’t thrilled with the color. The wheels roll easily, and the suitcase seems sturdy when I place a heavy carryon on top. The handle is easy to use with one hand. They don’t have much padding on the inside, and there aren’t any zippered compartments. They are pretty lightweight and seem durable. We have used them on 3 airline trips so far and no dents or scratches! All in all we feel like we got a good buy. They aren’t our forever suitcases but we plan on getting many years out of them.
title: Great suitcase!

author: B. Healy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2019
review_content: Didn't actually use this luggage, sent it back instead... It's a far cry from my older Samsonite Silhouette.  The sides seemed very thin and ready to crack at the slightest bump, especially when the bag is cold.  The expandable zipper area eliminated any structural integrity between the two sides and I could definitely see it getting shredded in the luggage machinery.  All in all I would say these bags would probably make a couple of flights OK, but could also fail miserably on the first trip.  Definitely they could not stand up to many trips, which is what I look for in baggage.  The price reflects the workmanship/materials, and I just don't see the point in saving a few hundred bucks and gambling on my bag showing up in pieces, especially if you have anything valuable in your luggage.  This luggage is slightly better than Samsonite Winfield 2, which I also ordered and returned.
title: Flimsy

author: S. K.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020
review_content: It's a good product. Looks stylish. Love the lock. Lightweight. However, I returned it because I felt it was too big for a checked bag on a flight. It's a personal preference. Dimensions may be slightly over the 62" max requirement, plus it gets to 50lbs even when it's 50% full. I'm going to downsize and buy the 25" checked instead, which I'm sure I can fill it to 50lbs worth.Note: I didn't know returning a product is not free, plus I accidentally threw out the box and had to pay for that too, both on the returning end, and on the reimbursement end also!
title: Too big for my preference, will go for the 25"

author: Jorge Coelho
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2016
review_content: I already own two   Samsonite Luggage Fiero HS Spinner 20          , which I purchased in the last year to upgrade carry-on luggage with the 360 degree wheels. In comparing the Fiero with the Omni, both pieces of luggage appear to be identical except for the design. I've included some pictures, so you can see some views of the two side-by-side.I really enjoy the suite case as it's very sturdy and lightweight, more so than my previous carry-on. The wheels wheels transition well from being pulled to being pushed. The material of the case itself is scratch-resistant, so while it will hold up to some wear it is not scratch proof. I've taken over 10 trips so far with the suite case and it has only very minor wear.I did not buy the suite case for the lock mechanism, although it was nice to know I could lock and TSA could unlock. Take note that the locks are TSA-compatible, so if you travel outside the US and your bags need to be opened they do not have the special TSA tool to open the bag. I encountered this accidentally on a recent trip where my bag (involuntarily checked) was opened by TSA, and then locked. I had never used the lock combination, so when I arrived I asked local airline reps for assistance opening the lock. They indicated that the lock tool was specific to TSA and USA and so they did not have the ability to open. I managed to get online and find out that default combination was 000, which promptly opened the bag. I would recommend setting a combination even if you don't plan to lock the bag.Overall this is a great bag and I was glad to add another to my options for traveling.
title: Same as Fiero w/ New Design ... Same Great Results

author: Em
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2019
review_content: I wish I got the orange/red color because it stands out more.  But the blue is pretty.  These hold a lot and all 3 pieces are expandable.  The largest piece is very big, but hey, I can throw my fav pillow in it, if necessary (big item, little weight)We wanted hard side luggage because one time our clothes got wet inside our Briggs Riley life time warranted soft side luggage (maybe torrential rains when unloading plane.... but still). We also wanted the latest awesome wheel system the new luggage has.  They seem durable, but we’ve only used them once.  I love that I can pack in 2 sides (one side is zippered so that you can close it without spilling everything from one side to the other.  The one thing I don’t like is that the built in TSA lock system is on the side, not the top of the luggage.  So you have to almost kneel down to open it.  The numbers are also so small that I’m just using my “large print” TSA locks.  The outside Is textured which I believe will help it look nicer longer.  It seems to be a good value, especially compared to our more expensive luggage that doesn’t pack or roll as well and is now antiquated ( and donated) even though it has a lifetime warranty.
title: Nice value, packs and rolls with ease.

author: J. Land
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2021
review_content: The wife wanted hard sided and colorful. I wanted to make sure we didn't have something that would break, or look like garbage after 1 trip. These fit the bill. We bought the 3 piece set, and a single medium sized one. We ended up only using the 3 piece set for a one week trip for our family of 4. They pulled the airport just fine, a little struggle on thicker carpets in the hotel, but that's what luggage carts are for.I will say this about the large one. If you're flying with it, it is almost impossible to pack at less than 65lbs. Maybe fill half of it with your favorite pillow? IDK. Our flight had a max of 70lb on the suitcases, so it wasn't an issue, but I know regular flights don't have that high of a weight limit without paying more. It's just very large!All the cases are very sturdy, surprisingly lightweight, and the textured exterior helps hide the inevitable scuff marks from baggage handling.After researching alot on these, I now understand that, especially if it's packed heavy, you should leave them on 4 wheels. Towing them on a tilt on 2 wheels is obviously faster, but I can see where that might be bad on those wheels in a parking lot. We have 2 little kids, so moving fast through the airport wasn't a reality anyway. Once you realize that speed is not an option, they push on 4 wheels surprisingly smooth and freely. A faster walking pace than my wife and 4 year old were comfortable with was easily achievable.
title: As good I had hoped

author: CJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2021
review_content: I really like the suitcase.  The hardside and expandability are hard to beat.  It looks super sleek.  The biggest issue is that about 18 months after buying this and using it on about a dozen trips, one wheel literally severed in half (yup - half so it cannot be wheeled anymore) on my last trip.  It looks like the rubber on the wheels is just not durable and it broke in half.Pros:+ Amazing Look (stylish)+ Hardside (protection for packed items)+ ExpandableCons- Durability (1 wheel severed in half after 18 months - 12 trips)- Maneuverability - not the easiest to maneuver.The biggest ding is durability for me.  A suitcase at this price should last a few years.
title: Great hardside carryon but not durable

author: True
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2021
review_content: Who buys white indeed? I tend to buy cases that stand out in a crowd. I figured white would not be typical in  airports. So far the small and medium have traveled within the US x3 and trans Atlantic x1 (with multiple stops and opportunities to be scratched and broken) and within the United Kingdom. The cases are undamaged! A few smudges, that wiped off. They are still very white. The roll beautifully, stack within each other and are light. Highly recommend.
title: Who buys white?

author: KAM905
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2021
review_content: I’ve been on 12 domestic flights with this suitcase and it’s held up beautifully. I have the teal color and there are no marks showing on it. Using packing cubes, I can pack for up to six nights with this medium suitcase expanded. Lighter packers can probably get more than a week from it. It wheels pretty easily when I pack so that heavier items are on the bottom when it’s upright being wheeled. I only bought the medium but am probably going to get the large and the roll-aboard sizes as well if I can find them. Highly recommend.
title: Sturdy and Practical

author: Ron in Idaho
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2020
review_content: Very light empty, expandable a few inches in thickness.  Holds about four pair pants, some winter underware, five pair socks, sweater, a thin rain jacket, rain pants, a pair sweat pants, two thick fleece pants for inside on a winter's night, , shorts, about six shirts, a thick fleece sweater/jacket, and more. Plenty for about a ten day stay without laundering anything.  Rolls OK, handle works well, lock it funky but functional . In my carry-on I take one pair light, waterproof LLBean hunting boots, a pair of leather slippers, and a pair of timberland leather boat-type loafers.I wear an insulated waterproof Columbia jacket and heavy pants and thick socks, with comfortable leather shoes, well broken in.  Extra winter top and bottom and other essentials go in the carry on.. This bag is perfect for my bi-monthly trips to Maine to see my girlfriend. My wife thinks I am going hunting all of the time. I guess I am.
title: Perfect for moderate checked baggage

author: Patrick J. Barrett
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2019
review_content: Less than 24 hrs after receiving this set i took it to the ultimate test by packing it up, and putting it on a plane from SF CA to Manila by way of Tokyo Japan!  I'm still in Manila, but the luggage is holding up great!  The picture shows the bag sitting in my Manila hotel room.  Minor scuffs on the wheels (which i would expect) but there's not a mark anywhere on the luggage itself.  All zippers seem smooth as well.  Early impressions are:  1)  The set is very light.  This was/is a bit concerning as the handles seem to distort the shape with the weight of the luggage, but otherwise all seems good.  2)  The set is roomy.  While packing i had my clothes piled up and thought, "no way this is all gonna fit in there".  But it did, with a lot of room to spare, and not even having to use the extenders!  3)  The big bag seems gigantic.  Not sure i've seen a piece of luggage this big.  I'm looking forward to filling it up at some point in the future.  So, this review is early, and my first trip is only half over, but i'm very impressed so far.  If i don't come back and update this consider this to be 5 stars all the way!
title: So far, so good!

author: Happy surfer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2019
review_content: I have just returned from 3 months traveling (my first trip with this case) and overall I am very happy with the purchase.I decided on this model of Samsonite because the exterior finish is textured and "matte" (vs. smooth and glossy) which i thought would be less likely to show signs of wear. I bought the color "teal" and it is more subtle (which i like) than in the photo online. Just enough to stand out from the similar style luggage on the airline connveyor belt without being too eye catching!After three months of travel by airline, boat, taxi, bus, bicycle taxi and cobbled streets, the exterior finish still looks great. The wheels did get less responsive as time went by, which made the case harder to steer, but I had a 50lb load so i am sure that was putting a strain on the wheelsl.The handle also got a little looser over time but never felt like it was going to fail.The interior is in great shape and the design of the interior works well once you get used to it.As with all suitcases of this style, remember to factor in the weight of the case itself.The locking system worked when i left for my trip. When i first collected my bag at my initial destination i found my case had been opened when i left the USA and the TSA had not reset the lock, so the case was not locked for the rest of the trip AND i could not lock it when i did receive it. Still need to get this sorted out by TSA but my advice is to take a small TSA approved padlock just in case.All in all it was a great purchase and i am satisfied !
title: Sturdy and good design, wears well

author: susancatton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2021
review_content: I am very pleased with this purchase. I've been looking at hardside luggage for years and finally purchased this one. The TSA lock was easy to set and my #1 reason for this purchase. It's lightweight, rolls smoothly, the handle is sturdy and the size is ample for a 1-week travel stay or longer. The color is nice and easy to identify on the baggage claim carousel. I've only used it on 1 flight so far and it came back with no scratches or wheel damage.
title: My first hardside suitcase

author: Guy Terry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2021
review_content: I travel (since COVID) every month for the Army Reserve, and I have to take a TON of stuff. This will fit everything I need for two weeks with two caveats: 1) pack with cubes or other small bags to keep stuff under control, and 2) be prepared for this back to be overweight, even when just packed with clothing. When it's not full, it works very well for me because I can quickly put my used laundry in a laundry bag and just throw it in without having to "squeeze" everything in.The wheel broke after 5 trips. It appears to be repairable, and I have submitted a claim to American Airlines. Because of the design, it seems to me that the wheels may be vulnerable.
title: Wheel broken after 5 trips, otherwise nice. Will see what the repair expense will be...

author: Stacy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2020
review_content: I honestly lost count how many business and leisure trips my husband has taken with this bag. He loves being able to throw his clothes in one side, and having the mesh zipper portion for his shoes and misc. items in the other side.  It meets all the international airlines size guidelines so it was very easy to travel overseas last summer for 2 weeks with just this bag.  It's extremely light weight, extremely durable, the wheels hold up, handle holds up, and let me tell you - WE HAVE USED AND ABUSED THIS THING.  We love it so much, when it was time to buy me a new piece of luggage, I bought the updated version of THIS EXACT MODEL.  We're seriously happy!  HANDS DOWN GREAT QUALITY!
title: 2 years with countless trips and still going strong

author: Andy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2019
review_content: The luggage looks nice and is spacious. We have traveled with it for 3 different trips now, and it worked well until our last trip.The zipper irreparably broke on the medium piece on our last return trip. This caused the contents of our luggage to dump out at the airport which caused damage and loss to our items inside (e.g. baby monitor camera). Besides the cost of buying more luggage and a new baby monitor system, the worst part was trying to lug the broken suitcase to the car without dumping out what was in it. The zipper should not have broken after only a handful of flights.Samsonite's website says they don't cover these types of damages.
title: Irreparably broken zipper on 3rd trip

author: Cory E Weatherton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2018
review_content: This has been with me on approximately 210 flights in the past year and a half.  Still going strong and well worth the money. When it finally gives up its ghost (which no sign of it being soon) I’ll definitely replace it with the same luggage.Update:Three years after original purchase, and a total of approximately 450 flight segments, this suitcase was still going strong. On my last flight I got the luggage off of the carousel and the corner of the suitcase had approximately a 3” crack in it. The airlines is replacing it free of charge with another samsonite. I guarantee if they would not have replaced it with a samsonite I, without hesitation, would buy another samsonite!  Great suitcase!!!
title: Over 200 Flights & Still Going... (updated)

author: Ryan C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2021
review_content: I was very excited to own a "Samsonite"! The space is nice,, maneuvers wells, and the lock is very handy. However, my excited was slowly diminished when I went to pick up my luggage after my flight. The handle was snapped off, the bars are bent and will no longer retract, and there is a huge dent on the corner. I'm very dissatisfied with the products durability. I was willing to pay the extra price for this brand to make it my forever luggage I can brag about. Simply put, that was not the case. Now I have to make another purchase for my upcoming flights. Great idea. I wouldn't recommend for frequent flyers.
title: Broke on first flight

author: Cynthia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2021
review_content: As a huge Samsonite customer, I'm utterly disappointed in this luggage. I purchased this and the carry on version right before my honeymoon. Both luggages purchased were extremely faulty; the wheel on the larger one stopped working properly while the other one continuously toppled over and the zipper kept jamming - only after using it twice.
