Both felt very unbalanced and wouldn't role properly. Crazy. I'm an avid traveler so this was a shock given I trust this brand. However, I recently found out that Amazon sells a lower quality version of the original samsonite luggage (which are these). The original samsonite that I purchased from the Samsonite store has lasted me 5 years! I am shocked this one fell apart so quickly. It is unfair for Amazon to lie to its customers, send them faulty luggage by a well known brand, then proceed to promise them a refund and not follow through with it. Mind you, you won't find THIS line at Samsonite.com - for good reason, it's a knock off version created for those looking for a bargain. Don't fall into the trap!
title: horrible luggage - cheap dupe of samsonite

author: Kevin S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2021
review_content: Pros:-Lightweight-TSA lock-Fits everything-Pretty spiffyCons:-Tends to lock up the wheels randomly when pushing the suitcase. Not a nuisance really, happens rarely.-Wish there was another zipper flap on both inside compartmentsOverall, it was a great purchase for the price. Perfect size for traveling around two weeks. I highly recommend purchasing this suitcase!
title: Nice suitcase for a 12 day trip

author: Lukaf
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021
review_content: I bought the 3 piece set for a two week+ trip. We drove, so didn't go through airport check in. The cases held up and I didn't have any issues with the zippers or wheels. The cases do feel a little flimsier than I thought they would, but other than a few scrapes, again didn't have any issues. I used all three cases for travel. The one thing that I didn't like is that you are filling up both sides of the suitcase, so depending on which side you are opening (only one side has a zipper/netting closure) your items fall out of the suitcase, even with the straps. Also, when you are traveling and you have your luggage on the luggage rack and you open up the zipper/netting closure, the items fall out of the suitcase. I've never had hardcase luggage before so maybe this is how they all work, but I found it to be rather inconvenient. I kept having to repack the suitcase and refold my clothes. My other suitcases you only packed one side of the suitcase, so this was never an issue. I hope these suitcases last. My kids were able to easily pull the suitcases, so no issues with maneuverability. Overall for the price, they worked well and hope to use them in the future without issues.
title: Worked Fine for Two Week Trip

author: Conan, The Flying Irish
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2018
review_content: The cases are nice and medium weight, a little too thin to my taste and silver is not what you see on the picture as dark grey, it actually is silver in real life, which was a deal breaker for me (need dark grey to match what I already have).The handles are not beefy to hold on too if fully loaded, no reinforcement of the plastic on the long side so the whole side waves up and down as you carry it. But overall good piece, polycarbonate is (though thin) will stand up to the beating better than any other plastic, so 4 stars overall... This is a suitcase you need to see "in person" before you can pull the trigger on it.
title: OK set, there are better

author: Tyler
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2017
review_content: Use this product on a bi-weekly basis. When unzipped for extra space, it meets overhead requirements for the JetBlue, United, and Spirit (these are the only flights I have been on so far with it. Also sat directly on this bag during a 45 minute subway ride because there weren't any seats. Very reliable travel companion!
title: Use this product on a bi-weekly basis. When unzipped ...

author: ES
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
review_content: The handle of my last Samsonite suitcase broke after over 10 years of use. I researched replacing it with a new Samsonite and chose this Omni hard side after reading reviews. On its first trip, because it rolls so easily, it got away from us while checking into an apartment in Spain and tumbled down a flight of stairs. I watched it fall end over end, crashing down the marble staircase and dreaded what I would find when I went to retrieve it.  I was so happy to find it undamaged! The locks still work and except for a few white scratches from the marble it looks new.It also has plenty of room, more than my last carry on bag.  I packed enough clothes, including warm, fleece pants and jacket for a 10 day trip in this one piece.  I ordered the teal, it is dark but a very pretty color.It rolls flawlessly through airports and on cobblestone streets. I would recommend it to anyone especially of you travel frequently.
title: very durable luggage

author: Sonya Weasner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
review_content: I bought this suitcase pre-pandemic for all of the travel I had coming up this year.  Obviously it hasn't been used much after most things got cancelled, but I have been able to use it twice and I really love it.  The color is FABULOUS, I love being able to push the suitcase (my old one was pull only), and the inner storage is designed really well.  I am able to fit a LOT into this suitcase, despite the fact it is smaller than my old carry-on.One thing I wish is that there was another handle on the side for lifting it up into the overhead bins.  It is just big enough that it's hard for a small girl like me to heft it up with only the top handle.
title: Love this suitcase!

author: J. Kantouth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2020
review_content: After having several soft side suitcases that were either heavy (eBags mother-load loved, but 12lbs for the medium) or too flimsy (various brands), I was in search of something light weight and sturdy.  I purchased these a year ago and have been pleasantly surprised.  Other than a scuff or two, the material has held up!  I have even had to travel with them expanded once.  The wheels still work perfect, the telescoping handles all still go up and down without hesitation.  I have not taken them internationally yet - that’s on our agenda this next year if Rona allows us to go.  The small carry on is perfect in size - you know it’s gonna fit in most overhead bins.  The medium is perfect to keep you under 50lbs and the large is good for that second traveler, but honestly it is too easy to get it over 50lbs.  I have purchased a few blow up pillows to take up light weight space to keep me from over packing and the space filled for a better travel experience. I love that they nest to save on storage space (if I had more storage I would have bought 2 small & 2 medium)  Overall I bought this set as a “lets try it and see”.  It was cheap enough that if I had to replace it in a year I wouldn’t cry too much.  A year has gone by and it’s been on 6 round trip plane rides and one car ride and I still feel it was a great purchase.  Hoping the next year (and more) of use is just as good to us.
title: Happier than I thought I would be

author: BMay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2016
review_content: Used these on a few different trips so far and they are quite durable even though very light.  I was concerned at first because each piece has the capability to expand using a zipper and it seemed at first it might compromise the integrity of its structure.  I put the largest to the test packing it to 70lbs for an international trip. Came through it perfectly and nothing inside was harmed.The spinners are also keeping up much better that my previous set of Tumi luggage of a similar style and look. Still rolling nice and easy and will continue to roll with a nice push on flat surfaces. My other set wouldn't do that after a trip or two.Not that this is too important to me, but the outside of the luggage is keeping up its appearance still looking new.  Scratches don't really show up at all. I'm very happy with this set and have every confidence that it will last.
title: Durable, Functional, and Flexible

author: 03mp
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2019
review_content: I don't travel a lot but our family needed an upgrade so we looked and purchased partially on the brand name at a reasonable price. The 3 pieces held up OK for a cross pacific trip and don't they make such a cute matching set? Well, we arrived to the airport and found that the airlines have a 50lb limit per bag so the larger of the group was a problem.If I was to do it again I would not buy this set. Rather than 1 small for carry and 2 or 3 mediums for the rest of my luggage. The weight limit was a bummer throughout our voyage as it's difficult to pack such a big case and not go over.
title: 50lb weight limit

author: C Burriss
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2020
review_content: This was our fourth piece from this line. I am a travel advisor so I end up traveling about once a month.  We love it because of how lightweight yet durable it is. I love that onside you can zipper off one side of the compartment. I also like that it comes in bright colors and stands out from the boring dark colored bags on the conveyor belt at the baggage claim. It is a great choice!
title: Cute, lightweight, durable

author: KP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2021
review_content: Nice looking suitcases that held up well during our road trip with just a few minor scuffs. I didn't foresee the issue of using them in small hotel rooms. This is the first clamshell style suitcase I've used and I wasn't impressed. Maybe other people are used to this style of suitcase but I found it to be a huge pain. Since you pack both side of the suitcase, as opposed to filling just one side, it has to lay open completely flat in order to access everything. Some hotel rooms we stayed in didn't have enough floor space to lay the suitcases out open. We had to lay them out on the bed, get out what we needed, zip them up and set them off to the side to inevitably need something else out of the bag and have to repeat the process all over again. Luggage racks don't work either because again the bag has to lay completely flat in order for you to open it or you risk everything in the top compartment falling out. As was the case multiple times when we realized we needed something out of the suitcase when it was in the trunk of the car and tried to get into the bag. We were constantly repacking and reorganizing these things.Also, there's no handle on the bottom of the bag. This drove my husband crazy when we were loading/unloading the bags during our road trip. Another negative is the lack of pockets. I was aware of this when I bought the bags. I didn't think it would bother me so much but it did! Even with packing cubes I was lacking the storage for small miscellaneous items or a place to put shoes. There is one zipper pocket on the inside that is so small and a pain to get to that I never even bothered using it. We bought these to upgrade a set that is 15 years old with wheels that are wearing out. I'd rather go back to using the old suitcases (thank goodness I didn't get rid of them) rather than travel with these again. Bummer I'm past my return date or else these would definitely be going back.
title: Not great to use in small places

author: Judy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2021
review_content: I love the color of the luggage, how easy it is to maneuver them around, the variety in sizes. I also like that there is a zipper to allow you to overfill them to take fewer suitcases. The smaller one when overfilled works great as a weekender suitcase. They are pretty lightweight when empty. The outside is pretty durable. We have had to pull them up cement stairs and the finish is still good on them.The only problem is we paid for a warranty on them and never did receive it! Still waiting to receive it and have misplaced the # of whom to contact to see what happened to it.
title: Durable, Easy to Maneuver

author: KKG
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2018
review_content: Not a bad choice given the brand name and the price. It is in decent size and I had plenty of room to pack for my 3 week trip across Italy in March, with room to spare after souvenir shopping.  It survived the trip just fine. No scratch, no damage, all still intact as is, so I am glad.One thing though, it doesn't wheel as smooth as I would have hope. While I'm impressed it survived all those cobble stone streets and being pulled and pushed up and down the hills (very impressive), however on regular flat surface pavement/street it did take me quite a bit of arm strength to keep the luggage going straight. It just swift left and right when I tried to make it go straight. Thought it could be how I packed my items inside/weight distribution (maybe one side was heavier than the other side), but after adjusting I only saw slight improvement. So not sure it's something about the wheels, or simply I didn't distribute the weight good enough.
title: Not a bad choice given the brand name and the price

author: LR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2018
review_content: I have NOT used these yet for a trip.  My first impressions: They arrived quickly, undamaged, and are attractive, color is nice.  For the price, they are very nice. I like the concept of the TSA combo-lock built into the side of the cases, though I have not tried it or tried to set it yet. All wheels, handles, etc., seem well attached.  Besides the slide-up handle there is a handle at top and top-side (none at bottom). All three cases nest together (you can pack one inside the next larger one, which is how they are shipped and arrived). They are very light-weight and very flexible, not rigid (which may lead to transference of impact energy into interior, so I would be careful about packing breakables in them without surrounding padding). They have a material closure around the zippers, in other words, they don't close plastic to plastic, so anyone could stick a knife into the soft zipper material and separate the top from bottom very quickly. Overall, I think they will be great for short, work and vacation, trips. When I use them, I will try and update this review.
title: Very nice so far

author: Stephanie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2017
review_content: Cheaply made for Samsonite. Not only is there a zipper broke but I found duck tape inside on one of the corners...what the?! So disappointed after looking for hours at luggage online, ugh!!
title: Cheap luggage

author: Kayleigh Harvey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020
review_content: I have had the carry-on version of this suitcase for a couple of years, and it has held up well to travel, even when I have to check it. I decided to get the medium-sized suitcase to match, and unfortunately it only survived 1.5 flights before the body of the suitcase collapsed and the wheel caved in. Based on the damage, I assume that one of the airline employees dropped it off of the conveyor belt that they use to load/unload the aircraft. It is unclear whether it would have been ok if it had impacted on a different part of the suitcase or not, but regardless it seems like the hard shell on the larger version of the suitcase is not as sturdy as the carry-on size. I'm disappointed that I spent $120 for a suitcase that lasted under two months and only survived 1.5 trips.
title: Lasted 1.5 trips

author: nicole
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2021
review_content: I ordered this to replace a 20-year old soft-sided carryon that was on its last legs. This is a little bit smaller than my old one, but I was impressed that it seemed like I could fit more in this one. I think it has to do with the way it’s split into two compartments.I just finished my first trip with it, and it’s been great. It’s very light and easy to maneuver. I had a few instances where the wheels wouldn’t go the way I wanted, when I was in a position to push, rather than pull it. There is only one handle (on top) and not a second one on the side, so that makes it a little more difficult to get out of the overhead compartment on the plane. The wheels seem sturdy, but they do stick out and I’d be worried about them being damaged if I were to check this bag instead of carry it on. Overall, I’m very pleased with this bag.
title: Light and compact

author: Sanjuana leal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2018
review_content: First of all, I want to state that I love my Samsonite Omni luggage set! The bags arrived promptly and were very well packed. They are beautiful, roomy, light and sturdy. I also ordered a set of luggage belts because I was traveling to China and I wanted to make sure that my lugagge didn't arrive with my clothes falling out(I had read some horror stories about that). So, when I checked in my lugagge I was very worried about how the bags were going to hold. To my amazement they arrived unscathed and the belts were still holding to the bags(I had read some bad reviews about those, as well). From China I traveled to Indonesia and although I only took the carry on. I was very happy to see that it performed very well during that trip also. The spinner wheels made it through bricks, and cobblestone sidewalks in China without any problems. Back at home I checked the bags for damages but I could only find a few scuffs. I used a wet washcloth to wipe any dirt they had before storing. I placed a small cedar disk inside to keep them smelling fresh. The pictures show the before(with belts) and after the trip(ready to store) bags. You can hardly tell the difference. Why 4 stars? Because the carry on needs a handle on the side. It will make it a lot easier when placing it in the overhead bin and when carrying it up and down stairs. Also, the zippered net insiside would be better if it had compartments or smaller bags to put underwear or small items in. I have seen both the handle on the side of the carry on and the zippered net with bags in other brands. So I know that Samsonite could add it to their bags as well. Also, the locks look weak, although they held very well this time. Overall, the bags are great and beautiful. I highly recommend them.
title: Beautiful and impressing!

author: 305fun
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2018
review_content: Super happy. Great set for a great price....2nd part of the reviewI just went on a 3 week trip to Bali and took one of the sets. The suitcase made it. It did have scratches which I expected but I was really bummed out when I had to brake the lock. I had the code working just fine and when I arrived at my first destination, it wouldn’t open... I was desperate and googled videos on how to reset code when locked- no luck. (Limited supplies where I was) so I had to jam it open. I know I didn’t forget the combination- it just did t want to open
title: Great set at a great price- but I think mine was faulty

author: Andrew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2017
review_content: First off this was crazy stupid insanely cheap.  I went to the Samsonite outlet near me, similar products are selling today for $190 or more for just the large piece.  I bought this for $244 for the whole set.Seems pretty nice.  The polycarbonate seems like it should hold up well and not be too susceptible to scratches.  Very light - If I had to guess about 50% lighter than my 10 year old soft side Samsonite suitcases.The reason why it would be 4 stars right now if it wasn't for the incredible price:--Seems alarmingly flimsy.--Has one small pocket and then a separated area in the lid portion.
title: First off this was crazy stupid insanely cheap

author: Michael George
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2019
review_content: I've had this bag for 2 years now. The outside shell has held up very well. It also expands tremendously which is great! However, the wheels are TERRIBLE. They're so tiny and hard to maneuver and if your bag has any sort of weight then they will grind down and disappear within a couple of months. Also, the inside of the bag is SUPER basic. There are no compartments or anything, just two giant spaces for your items.
title: It is a sturdy basic, but it lacks compartments and the wheels are terrible!

author: Ms. Manley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2019
review_content: I have been using this luggage monthly for about 18 months.  The wheels are junk and had to be replaced. See photo of the flat wheel that I had to drag thru the airport and it scratched my hardwood floors. I have other cheaper luggage with better wheels.  The handle jams all the time - won't slide into the bag without several forceful attempts.  The description mentioned scratch resistant and mine were scratched after the first use as a carry on, so don't count on that attribute.  The only positive is that they are lightweight.
title: Poor quality wheels and mechanics

author: chris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2021
review_content: I really liked the style of this suitcase when we got it. We bought 2 to use on a recent trip and the handle on one of them broke when being put in the car at our destination. I’m very disappointed and considering returning both suitcases. Our last set of hard sided suitcases lasted about 12 years and dozens of domestic flights.  They only had to be replaced because one of the wheels was damaged. We purchased Samsonite suitcases this time with the hope they’d be slightly better quality.
title: Not Very Durable

author: K Timmons
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2021
review_content: I used this suitcase once and the wheel broke off. Very dissatisfied and disappointed with Sampsonite. They used to make one of the best suitcases.
title: Not well made

author: Dr. WILL KIRBY
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2021
review_content: This suitcase/luggage piece itself is fine. Not great, but adequate. But it’s one inch smaller than the nearly exact same one from Amazon. Both are 100% acceptable to carry on from all major airlines. So why wouldn’t you go with the one that’s bigger and cheaper but the same quality. Both are expandable, 360 wheels, etc. I wish I had ordered the Amazon one first because I had to return this one and the company doesn’t offer free returns. Bottom line is to just order the Amazon version.
title: No free returns!!!!!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2021
review_content: Though I understand the liability of frequent travel this was a product with a number of good reviews. And not inexpensive. However, LESS THEN A MONTH within receiving this product the zipper handles that attach to the TSA lock completely broke. To the point that I can't even put replacement on the zipper that there is no longer anything to attach to as you can see in the photos. The material of the luggage was good. The maneuverability was good. But the durability of the productwas crap. Upon inquiry as to the warranty or exchange process I was simply referred to Samsonite. So that tells me in future not to purchase to the seller and to go directly to the source. Very VERY disappointed in this product!
title: Not as durable as they say!

author: AStricklin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
review_content: Great luggage - Colors are WAY off.  I love the 3-piece set I got.  The only downer is that the color - Caribbean Blue - looks nothing like what is pictured online.  I love the online color, which is a bright sea blue.  What you get is something that is a very dark turquoise - accent on the VERY DARK.  Really looks more like a medium dark green than anything else.  Nothing like pictured.  Which is too bad.  I have a Samsonite cosmetic case that IS that color.  So, it doesn't match.  Wish I could get it in the actual color in the description.
title: 3 piece set, Caribbean Blue (not).  Great luggage - Color WAY off

author: Gelo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2018
review_content: Took this on a 2 week trip in Japan where we stayed in 3 cities.  Took it on planes, trains and buses.  Replaced a cheap spinner that would tip over easily.  This was very stable compared to our previous spinner.  Only downside is that the wheels are a little small, so it would sometimes get hung up on the larger cracks on the walkways and was a little difficult in any carpet that's more plush than your standard office carpet.  The handles is sturdy and doesn't have any excess give.
title: Works well and seems robust enough to last more than a few years.

author: Jennifer Ryczko
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2021
review_content: The top handle tore right off during my first leg of my trip. I bought this set in October for my August trip to Hawaii. I loved the color and it looked sturdy. But once we arrived at the airport the top handle broke right off as it was being placed on the scale. This in turn made the suitcase incredibly hard to lift and push due to the top handle being gone.
title: Broke on first use

author: Jeffrey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2018
review_content: I used this suitcase to take to France, Italy, Spain and several trips within the United States. This bag was small enough to fit on all the trains in those European countries and it was able to fly easily on all of the airlines I used. I find it to be very lightweight considering that it is hard sided luggage. The wheels have held up great to several miles of pulling it through the streets of Europe and here in the USA. The handle is sturdy. When you expand the luggage it gains a ton of extra space. The bag looks good too.
title: This bag was small enough to fit on all the trains in those European countries and it was able to fly easily on all of the airlines I used

author: john lyon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2021
review_content: Very flimsy construction, slide handle is loose and wobbly feeling, inside zipper pull is missing, stitching is unraveling. Really don't believe that this will stand up to any level of use. The inexpensive set i bought from Wally World several years ago has endured 2 dozen trips and is still a lot more sturdy than this cheap plastic thing. Samsonite of the past was incredible, durable, rugged, stylish. This is none of those things.
title: Samsonite..SURE NOT WHAT IT USED TO BE!

author: nnk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2018
review_content: We bought this for a 4 week vacation in Europe. After about 10 days of usage, the wheels started screaming when I rolled the bag and the resistance in the wheels increased dramatically. We had 20-25 kg in the bag, but it was raining on many of the locations we visited so maybe the rain destroyed the wheels.When we got back to San Francisco and hoped to get the failed bag replaced, we learned that Samsonite don't care much for the fact that it failed so quickly on the trip as we will be forced to pay $15 to ship it to a repair center, not knowing if they will do anything at all.On the same trip we used a 5 years old Tumi bag. Its a lot more expense and had zero issues with the trip.The samsonite bag is at this point worthless to us, as it randomly locks the wheels. My advice to other buyers is NEVER to purchase a $100 bag if you intent to use it. Save more money and buy a proper well designed bag instead.
title: Useless wheels - don't waste the money

author: Maxx Racer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2021
review_content: I absolutely needed a new case and wanted one that would not be too big but not too small for being checked luggage. Absolutely needed to have four wheels as my two wheeler was getting a little bit tough to wheel around as it did put a strain on my back. This was a perfect choice and worked out exceptionally well. It has held up to three trips across the Atlantic so far and still looks new. It is sturdy and light weight.  I am very happy with this case.  You will too.
title: It’s perfect!

author: Didi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021
review_content: Having to purchase a new suitcase was quite stressful. The original one, used just once, was totally destroyed, by the airlines. It wasn't a cheap unit and but made me extra think on a replacement. This Samsonite was a good choice, so far. It's a perfect size for me. It's maneuverability is wonderful; touch of a finger (almost). The handles are good construction. Easy locking and unlocking. Seemed to have made it thru without any markings of any type.
title: Sturdy

author: Tim in Colorado
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2018
review_content: The plastic flexes on this more than I expected.  Which while OK for the sides, is a bit of a problem for the wheels.  When full (50 lbs) plus another 20 lb duffel on top, there were times when one of the wheel bases would give way and bend inward.  Only happened a few times, but I suspect after that happens a few more times that's gonna weaken the case around the wheels and they'll start to fail altogether.Samsonite should have designed these with a full hardside bottom to prevent that.  We bought 2 of this model specifically because they were about a pound lighter than similar alternatives, but I guess that's where part of the weight savings came from.Also a bit disappointed in the single-wheels instead of the double-wheels like our previous Samsonite hard-shells had.
title: More flex than expected

author: Kipp Bennett-Chew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2021
review_content: I like how sturdy this thing is. It feels rock solid. Despite that, I think they managed to keep the weight down considerably relative to other hard shell suitcases. I have another hard shell from a different company, and I knew for a fact that I wanted my most valuable items to travel in this one. Strapped an entire PC in here (only took graphics card out) and it survived TSA. I think its likely that this case had something to do with that.
title: kept my PC safe from Texas to England and back

author: Helen L. Sims
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2021
review_content: I purchased this suitcase immediately before taking an international trip in March to Turks & Caicos then on to Miami, and Ft. Myers before heading home to Kentucky.  It is lightweight, which is very important to me, and the wheels roll smoothly and easily, even with a full 50 pounds.  It is easy to pack and hold things in place as well.  I have used the lock on the suitcase too and it is easy to operate and I like knowing that things in my suitcase won’t be taken out or the suitcase rummaged through.  I have not had a TSA notification in my suitcase, which makes me very happy. It is pretty durable, and fairly scratch resistant.  I have a few marks, but not scratches.  I highly recommend this suitcase.
title: Great Suitcase and light weight too

author: Victoria Glasel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019
review_content: We ultimately decided to buy this set for ~$40 more than an off brand set from Amazon. We were very impressed. While they're not as light as I initially expected, they move smoothly regardless of how much you cram in there. The expansions are nice as are the mesh separators and straps inside. The locks were easy to reprogram and the zipper pulls themselves are really sturdy. They were packed to the gills on our way back from a trip last week, we managed to pack the largest one with almost 80 lbs of stuff initially and it still maneuvered very well and was able to handle it. In the end we packed about 50 lbs of things in each size and all of them handled it well. None of them took any damage during our 5 flights despite how full they were. My only complain is that the exterior texture picks up a lot of dirt/dust from flat surfaces like concrete or tile if you lay them down, a warm rag wipes it right off though. We will definitely order another set if we need more luggage for an upcoming trip.
title: Beautiful, Durable, Expandable, Dependable

author: Debounce
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
review_content: This luggage set is pretty practical and looks really nice.  They are a shell that opens like a clam.  There is a pocket on one side of the luggage to store shirts or pants in.  The rest of the luggage is pretty much open so you can store all your things.  It definately doesn't have the organization system other suitcases may have, but this thing is LIGHT!.The wheels roll buttery smooth.  My only concern is that they are made out of a hard plastic like material.  I can see the wheels wearing down if pulled across rough surfaces very often.Other than that, I am very happy with this purchase.
title: Very light weight, rolls butter smooth.

author: Surprised Pikachu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
review_content: *I've only used for three flights as of review*I bought two. Appears to be good so far, no issues as of yet and doesn't seem like there will be any. I've only ever used a rucksack so I'm not too experienced with these type of luggages but it seems to be of good quality and looks like it will last. That being said I do not stuff them to the max. I got two to avoid a tight squeeze. If you are going to fill this up with heavy bricks I do not know how long the material will hold. Average weight in mine was ~40 lbs for all my flights.On a side note it is very hard to get stickers to stick due to the surface, and when they do stick it feels like a mild breeze will knock em off. I know some people like decorations all over their luggage so you may want to take this into consideration. I just spray painted mine to stand out.
title: Happy with the quality

author: Robin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021
review_content: I mean... it's Samsonite, so how can you go wrong?? Plus an entire set, in my favorite color. So easy to identify when in baggage claim. And a rugged, solid set so I don't have to worry about contents being damaged. Plus the lock that can be configured with your own code. Bought this set when I was headed out to Nashville last month. Wasn't sure what size suitcase I'd need, but figured this set would last for whatever my needs are going forward. Very happy with this purchase. Oh, and the wheels on the bottom make each piece extremely easy to navigate. Very smooth...
title: Quality luggage

author: Glitter Girl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2018
review_content: Being that the measurements are a little sketchy, I was a little worried about the strict airline policies on carryon luggage - especially United.  I was able to travel to Mexico with this no problem. It also fit easily in the overhead bin. The zippered expansion area allows for the bag to compress somewhat - just don't over fill it because the bag may not work in the little measurement bin.  I used this with pretty compression cases I also purchased from Amazon and was able to pack a ton of clothes, bathing suits and sandals with no problem. I had to google a tutorial on how to change the lock but once I did, it was simple. Love steel blue so this suitcase makes me smile in every way.
title: Perfect carryon, the blue color is gorgeous.

author: bouncin_frog
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2020
review_content: Cool color and I’m hoping these bags will hold up.  Cats can’t damage these with clawing or puking and while I didn’t use them I like the TSA lock feature on the bags.  I find it ironic that this set cost less than my old one (which wasn’t from a brand known for making high quality luggage).  I’m still hoping to use these for more exciting travel but time will tell.
title: The Big Suitcase Passes Checked Bag Limits!!

author: Cameron
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2020
review_content: It is very difficult to roll on all 4 wheels.  Ends up being an arm work out to keep it up right.  I typically put my backpack on top of it which makes it very inconvenient to roll on 4 wheels.  Wish I would have splurged for the Away Suitcase or one with two wheels.  I travel to 1-2 different states per week and this doesn’t cut it for me.
title: If frequent traveler splurge for spinners w 2 wheels

author: shookie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2016
review_content: Medium sized suitcase survived planes, trains and automobiles on its first outing without a scratch.  I was impressed with the generous interior size and the suitcase itself is very light making it very easy to handle even when fully packed.  Easy to steer and even easier to spot on the baggage carousel.  Definitely can't beat the Amazon price either!
title: I was impressed with the generous interior size and the suitcase itself is very light making it very easy to handle even when fu

author: lexie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2020
review_content: I bought these suitcases to fly internationally. I have flown twice internationally with them and plan to use them again in a few weeks. I packed them to exactly 50 pounds apiece and checked them both times and at the end they came back to me in one piece and look brand new. As someone who flies internationally several times a year it says a lot about a suitcase that it can fly internationally at 50 pounds and come back to you in the same condition. I approve of the suitcases we shall see after a few more trips how they do.
title: Great suitcases for multiple international trips!

author: KKN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2017
review_content: I initially bought this for an overseas trip to Japan. The color is beautiful & was easy to spot during luggage claim. The textured outer shell held up nicely, as I returned home from a 2 week trip with no scratches or dings.This is my fault for not having proper expectations, but the size was a bit bigger than what I was initially looking for...as in too spacious. I had to pack a flat pillow to keep my things from sliding around. Again, that was my fault for misjudging the size. For my next trip, I would probably get the same model in the next size down.
title: Solid luggage

author: Presto
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2018
review_content: This is the second time we’ve bought this suitcase. We like the size, durability, wheels, and inside compartments a lot. The TSA lock is a bonus. Overall, it’s easy to travel with (I have taken it to several continents now) and holds up well. If I could change anything about this bag it would be the handle situation. First, there is only one handle. Some of the photos show two handles, but that’s not true. Second, the one handle the bag has is fairly tight and a bit too inflexible. There is no cushion or give. If you end up having to carry the bag by the handle for too long (which we all know you have to do at some point if you do a lot of air and city travels), it’s not very comfortable.
title: Great bag overall, but make peace with the handle situation

author: Duran W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2021
review_content: The zipper failed causing luggage to open on two different occasions , airlines and cities during my trip. My belongings including my safe containing my firearm was exposed. One airline taped the bag shut. Thankfully my firearm was still in the bag both times. After the first time I closed my bag back up using the zipper and it seemed fine until it happened again. Imagine my angst of considering what could have happened with my firearm. This is only my 2nd time using this luggage.  I purchased Samsonite model 68311-1041 luggage because I wanted a durable and dependable set of luggage and I didn’t get that. I’m very disappointed.
title: Zipper FAIL

author: Savannah Girl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2021
review_content: I used to own Samsonite and it lasted for many years. I needed a carry on bag but this is a cheaply made product at a premium price. It’s soft as in easily pushed in even though it states it’s a hardside piece of luggage. There is only one handle on top and it’s a plastic flimsy tight fitting handle.  The wheels seem decent which is the only good part of this luggage. I’m extremely disappointed and will be returning.
title: Disappointed. Not what I expected from Samsonite

author: Steelermaven
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020
review_content: I ordered this about 3 weeks ago for an upcoming trip and saved ALL packaging. Set it aside and began packing today. Went to use the built in lock and realized the connector strap is missing.  Will be using my own lock now. Since I saved all packing in case of a return I was able to check and see that the part was truly missing as was any booklet to explain how to use it.I’ll add to this review onceI know how it fares on my trip.
title: Check for ALL Parts to the Lock

author: Flyerfan074
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2018
review_content: Love, love, love this luggage. I don't think there's a better value out there at this price point. It's lightweight and durable. The casters spin easily and all of the pieces (even the largest one fully loaded) are a breeze to manoeuvre. The smallest one fits easily in the overhead bin, which is a must. They're equipped with TSSA approved lock, however no instructions on how to change the combination so I had to do some internet searching for that one. I've used them all for both air and land travel and there are minor scuffs, but that's to be expected and they're not really noticeable unless you're looking for them. Interiors are roomy and consist of a long zipped pocket along the inside edge (good for belts, a pair of sandals, etc.), one side has straps and the other has a zip mesh cover. All of the pieces are also expandable. Would definitely recommend.
title: Excellent value for a high quality luggage set

author: OkieGirl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2016
review_content: Best luggage I have ever owned. They have held up well to our adventurous international travel. Dragging them through the airport. Checked baggage horrors of rough handling. Hopping on and off trains and buses. Rolling them several blocks down sidewalks in search of our hotel. They rolled relatively easy in any direction. So glad I chose this set. Love it!!
title: Best.Luggage.Ever!

author: Amazonian616
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2018
review_content: Looks great - I have it in orange and silver.  Both the pattern and the color are awesome.  Lightweight, easy to roll.  Took four pieces of check-in luggage to somewhere in Asia from somewhere in the midwest, USA.  No dents, no major damage.  Just a few minor scratches, which probably cannot be avoided altogether, no matter what you check in.  Be aware though that if you are thinking about purchasing this in silver - IT LOOKS NOTHING LIKE THE PICTURES of the 20" (or the 24").  The pictures don't look silver at all (more like a light brown), but the luggage itself DOES look silver.  Check out the photos of "silver" in the other size (28) - I think those photos better represent what you are going to get.
title: Survived a 2-stop international trip roundtrip intact, with minor scratches here and there.

author: AmandaS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2019
review_content: Recently purchased this suitcase for a one week Vegas trip. Seller is awesome as it arrived much quicker than I thought it would. I purchased the 24" in purple which is a little out of character for myself as I prefer everything black, but the color is really sharp and stands out in the sea of black luggage at the bag pickup. The outside casing is a textured plastic which appears to be pretty rugged - I've only taken it on the one trip so far but I did witness a rather hard impact onto other luggage on the baggage carousel. It came out with only one tiny scuff that I noticed at the airport which apparently was so minuscule that I can't even locate it now.  The expansion zipper was a life-saver as I (surprisingly) left Vegas with more than I came with, lol.  The handle works extremely well and the wheels are smoooooth like butter - I could not believe how easy it was to maneuver this thing. The one thing that I am not a super fan of is the integrated TSA lock - in theory it's a good idea but I can see it being a bit of a hindrance in locking the suitcase if you are a TSA agent and in a hurry, which I imagine they usually are. I just bought a separate Samsonite lock off the shelf, which is an added cost, but totally worth it to me for the peace of mind. Overall I love this suitcase and cannot wait to use it for another trip!
title: Good looking and smooooth rolling...

author: ccpuff
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2021
review_content: I’ve only used the suitcases a handful of times and one of the wheels on the 22’ spinner is stuck and drags on the floor. I tried calling Samsonite support two weeks ago, but the number says that they aren’t taking calls due to Covid (it is March 2021!!) and to email for a quicker reply. I sent an email to the support email address and haven’t heard back in 2 weeks...all I need is a replacement wheel. Seems like others have the same problem
title: Wheels aren’t great. Lightweight

author: JD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2018
review_content: I bought this 8 weeks ago and it has now been on 6 trips.  It was great at first but the last couple trips it just didn't roll well and the last trip I ended up pulling it through the airports like a standard 2 wheel bag.  I haven't had the broken wheel problems that others have had and the wheels don't bind when testing.  The issue is that with any weight in the bag, if it's not on a glass smooth concrete or tile floor, pushing it in any direction causes it to tip.Other than that it's a nice bag but I really need to be able to wheel it through the airport and not pull it behind me.
title: Does not roll well....

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2021
review_content: I have all 3 sizes, this is specifically for the carry-on. I used it 1 time on my way to Cairo, Egypt and upon arrival 1 wheel was missing as if it was not screwed in properly. I will not be back in the US until next summer (I work overseas) or I would happily return it or attempt to use the warranty. Not sure if it is possible to get the wheel replaced but even if this is possible I would not recommend this suitcase as I do not think it is durable. I travel a significant amount & have used Samsonite for decades. This is not the quality I expected with this price & brand. Very disappointed. Hope the other 2 at least last until I can buy a better option.
title: Not Durable

author: Jessica
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2018
review_content: UPDATED (11/9/18): Second time using the luggage and only the first time using the medium sized bag (we only used the carry-on and large size for the trip abroad). The medium suitcase was used for a trip from the Midwest to LA and the handle completely broke off (see photos). This is completely unacceptable for the first time using the piece.ORIGINAL: We purchase a set in teal and liked it enough to purchase a second set in gray, so that we wouldn't have to fight over who gets what size suitcase when we're both traveling. I had shopped around a lot online and was having a hard time coming to terms with the price of hard case luggage. I came across this set on Amazon and decided to give it a try. It held up very well for a recent trip abroad -- lugging it on planes and trains. It's a hard case luggage set that has some give/flexibility -- so it's not 100% hard case. Because of that, I think that's why they're able to make it lightweight and at the price point currently listed. No major scratches, dents, etc. as some other reviewer experienced. Very happy with the purchase and would highly recommend.
title: sturdy and affordable hard case option

author: James B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
review_content: This is supposed to be a carry on bag but united airlines wouldn't let me carry on!  Charged me $30 Disappointed! Overall seems well made Moves easily. Carried seven days of clothes with hygiene. All hot weather clothes and long sleeve fishing shirts. I over packed! Still had room. The only thing I noticed is the zipper lock protrudes from the corner and already hit a few things just going on one trip. I hope in the future it doesn't get broken off. But Alot better that shouldering a large duffle bag running into people looking like a tourist!
title: Locking Zippers protrude off the side.

author: Jason Kientz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2019
review_content: The box arrived slightly mangled and barely taped shut on one edge.When opened and pulled it out, one side of it had been jammed into the other peeling back the black plastic lip that goes around the edge of the luggage. Inside everything seemed to be fine, although I noticed that the lining zippers didn't actually have a tab to pull on them, will have to rectify that with small keyring or the like.Ultimately, I figured this wasn't worth trying to get a return or replacement on the product so we'll see how it holds up.
title: Shoddy packaging/shipping?

author: Ginger Michele
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2021
review_content: I bought the entire luggage set because of the high ratings and glowing reviews, so I really wanted to like it. The “360degree” wheels just don’t perform the way I expected them to. No matter which bag size you choose, the entire bag will tend to tip forward when rolling it upright anytime you start to walk quickly.  The wheels feel like they are strained under the friction of weight when the bag rolls and the wheels do not glide the way my old suitcase used to, even when on hard surfaces. I found myself lowering the height of the handle to try to counteract the bag’s tipsy-ness, but the tipping situation did not improve. Perhaps I’m just spoiled from my last Rimowa suitcase?  After an airplane trip with a connecting flight involving a long terminal to navigate to the next gate, I’ve decided these bags are not my jam.  They only give 30 days to return so don’t waste time sending them back if you’re not happy with your set.  Definitely regretting this work-related splurge.
title: Tipsy Bags - It rolls… but it doesn’t glide

author: Unagi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2020
review_content: (Bought this recently and haven't used it yet.) After comparing with some other samsonite suitcases, I decided to keep this as the quality is good for the price. Exterior is scratch resistant (which was important to me as I am going to use this for long international travels for many years), handles seem to be of good quality, and comes in attractive colors. I went with the Caribbean blue color. I am hoping this purchase is good and the wheels are also of good quality (don't know how to judge this without using it).
title: Scratch resistant and good price

author: Kristen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019
review_content: This is the first set of luggage I've ever bought myself. I lugged these bags all over Europe and the U.S. in planes, trains, and automobiles, and they have held up phenomenally. The smallest bag is great as a carry-on for most American airlines, but has to be checked on many of the European ones. Make SURE you check the allowable measurements anytime you fly. I love the Caribbean Blue, too. It really stands out in the countless black suitcases on the carousel.
title: My favorite luggage ever!

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2021
review_content: Very crisp white color. Only negative is the locking system. Samsonite: Please get it together and listen. Your directions for setting the lock are just plain wrong. Thank you to the others who have posted the RIGHT way to set your own lock combo.
title: Nice bag, read other users info re: combo lock

author: cjduby
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2018
review_content: Had put off purchase for few months since wasn't sure how the material would hold out but finally decided to give it a try. Puchases the black color set a 2 week trip the large and mid size did great. With about 22lbs on the large one you could roll it where ever you liked with ease. The little wheels feel really smooth. Granted both had a couple of scuffs from when they where unloaded/loaded to different airplanes but that we really can't control. I would definitely recommend this set of luggage. The large one can be a bit on the heavy side but we did carry enough clothing for full trip for about 2.5 people but I think 2 of the mid size (1 per person) is better, more maneuverable (not as heavy to load/unload from vehicles).
title: Great product

author: Charles
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2021
review_content: We literally used it only twice and the wheel fell off the largest suitcase. And the return window is closed now with amazon. What to do? Amazon should stop selling junk that is defectively made. What a piece of crap.
title: Wheel fell off after 2 months. Don't buy this junk.

author: D. Elmore
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2019
review_content: This suitcase size is considered “oversize” by the airlines, which I was not aware of, and they were going to charge $200 when I checked it just because of the dimensions.  Be aware of airline dimensions for luggage before you buy. It’s a nice suitcase but I had to return it and get a smaller size.
title: Considered “oversize” by airlines and costs a lit of money to put on the flight.

author: R. Kallgren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2021
review_content: I have had the suitcase approximately one year and only used it three or four times. During the last use, right when I got to the airport, I noticed the suitcase was very hard to roll and realize that one of the wheels had gone missing. I was able to complete the trip dragging this suitcase around on three wheels, and submitted a warrant claim (supposed 10 yr warranty) and have gotten no response over a week later.  I also looked on Amazon for a replacement wheel but as others have mentioned in the reviews they don’t seem to be available. I hate to trash this otherwise good suitcase, but I’m not sure what my other options are. I will avoid this case and all Samsonite products moving forward.
title: Avoid - broken wheels an no warranty response

author: Kelvin Cornish
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2019
review_content: Excellent set of luggage. Survived 9 day trip to England and France. All three pieces were checked both ways. There were no dents and only a few very minor scratches. We used public transportation for all travel from airports to hotels. This included time on busses, up and down stairs in the tube and train stations, as well as a trip on the Eurostar to Paris. There were several long walks on various surfaces including cobblestone. The wheels performed very well, no problems. The handles and zippers worked just fine. We expanded the mid-sized suitcase for the trip home, no problems with that. The only slight complaint I have is the lack of zippered storage in the center divider. Other than that, I highly recommend this set.
title: Survived European Vacation with Grade of A+

author: VG Chicago
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2018
review_content: The handle of the suitcase broke as I arrived at the airport and lifted it to weigh it for the first time. It was under 50 lbs, so it was not a weight issue. I had purchased the ASURION protection plan based on other reviews, but the one that was offered when I purchased these did not cover one suitcase. So now I'm stuck with one broken suitcase out of a set of 3. VERY FRUSTRATED AMAZON CUSTOMER!
title: SUITCASE BROKE ON DAY 1

author: Mike Mier
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2019
review_content: I ordered this complete set in 2018 - have only used them several times - but as I prepared for my next adventure I see one of the wheels is pushed in to the luggage - making it inoperable.  Cannot find any information regarding the warranty on the Amazon site - very frustrated.  The product information claims a 10 year warranty on the product for workmanship - but good luck finding any information as to how to file a claim.
title: Warranty Information Not Easily Found

author: Patricia5000
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
review_content: The Samsonite Omni PC HardSide luggage that we ordered back in November 2019, is durable, light weight, easy to maneuver with the 360 wheel capability and made of quality materials. My family & I took it with us on a trip to Portland and it held everything we needed. We will be utilizing this suitcase for all of our international trips in the near future. Purchase with no cares in the world, My fellow “Amazon Shoppers”, you won’t be disappointed.
title: Our New Samsonite Omni PC HardSide Luggage Is Awesome 😎

author: Able S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2021
review_content: Not just for clothes. I was always looking for clean, safe and easy storage for my equipment when I travel to client homes. This is 20 inch carry on is a great size to hold my supplies and is light enough to lift in and out of the car multiple times a day. It is durable enough for knocking against door frames and slipping into tight places without showing much surface damage too.
title: Great choice!

author: Sandra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2017
review_content: Took this suitcase to Spain, Portugal, and Morocco for almost 3 weeks! Just a few scuffs but it held up just fine. The rolling is a bit of a struggle when the floor is not a smooth surface so I'm docking a star. Overall, I do like the overall look of the suitcase and the sturdiness of the outer shell. It's also quite roomy inside especially when expanded.
title: Nice looking luggage! Wheels could be better...

author: Indie Reader
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2018
review_content: I got this for my son to take on an 8th grade Washington DC trip. His group didn't want to worry about students checking luggage, so I searched for something he could carry on, and ultimately decided on this one. Unfortunately, he had to check it—not because of its size, but because the flight was "full." The airlines (United) didn't charge for the checked baggage... I'm guessing because he had to check it in spite of its carry-on size. Anyway, it held up well, and he was able to pack three pairs of jeans, three pairs of shorts, six t-shirts, a lightweight rain jacket, socks, underwear, and his favorite hoodie... quite a bit considering he only changed his clothes twice the whole week. Overall, I'm very pleased with this purchase.
title: Holds More Than Expected

author: Do We Really Need So Much Stuff?
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2018
review_content: Good quality on the surface, this appears to be as sturdy and well made as the $250 Samsonite version sold in the department store. Held up to our first flight. Seems to hold about 30lb. of stuff with no problem. But really, all these new roller 'hardside' suitcases are made of this thin cheap plastic that flexes easily, and after a trip they all seem to have white plastic fatigue marks in them from where they were thrown, so who knows how long this will hold up?
title: Can you even buy a super durable suitcase anymore?

author: Seth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2021
review_content: The plastic that holds the handle broke. Is was the first trip a couple of weeks after purchase. When I went online to replace it, I was surprised that I have to pay to send it back. Wow! I'm very disappointed with Samsonite. I decided not to replace it and will try Pelican. They have a lifetime warranty and there's no charge to the customer.Update: I received an email that I cannot send it back for a refund. I can have it sent back to me to go through warranty or take a 50% loss for a restocking fee. Give me a break!
title: Top handle broke on first trip

author: Briana
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2021
review_content: Holds quite a bit after a 4 day trip. Easy to maneuver and the hard shell is good for temperamental PNW weather. I now have a set of these - this small size and the next size up. Definitely recommend for the quality and price.
title: Perfect little traveler

author: mdsjhawk83
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2021
review_content: I’ve used it for one international trip so far and it seems to be sturdy and safe.  Packing it full goes over the 50lb limit for bags, because it is a bit heavy itself. That said, it is very spacious and was enough room for my husband and I on an 11 day trip.  I wish there were more pockets, which is mainly why I rated it a 4 and not a 5.  I will update after we use it next, if anything changes.
title: Not perfect but very good

author: Danielle French
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2019
review_content: I needed a larger suitcase that will need to be checked (ended up getting the 24” bc I’m small and 28” is too difficult to maneuver when traveling abroad). I did A LOT of research and ended up going with this case. & I’m so happy I did! This case looks like it will be able to hold up with being tossed around. Very pleased with my purchase. Plus the Caribbean blue is so pretty :) it will stand out when grabbing off the carousel. When I need a new carry-on, I’m def getting the Omni...Other pros: lightweight (so you can put more stuff inside), easy TSA locks, moves/glides around smoothly (so you can dart thru the airport when running late), fun color options, scratch resistant
title: Just Buy it already!!

author: Chad Hansen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021
review_content: Great suitcases so far. Used them for one trip and they have done great. Only part that could use some redesign is the lock. It works but both of the locks were not functioning properly when we got home. Some quick googling showed me how to fix it but over all the suitcases have been great. Tons of room in them and the zipper compartment is great!
title: Great suitcases

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2018
review_content: I travel for work every week. Sometimes multiple locations a week which means lots of flight time... The small one is great for a carry on and they deem to do well as checked luggage.  I read all the reviews and specifically selected these as they came with high recommendations by frequent travelers. Glides smoothly, even on uneven surfaces and they are very light.  I will say I’m a little sad that it didn’t have better separation between compartments instead of just mesh, but that’s my fault for not reading as well as I should have.  That being said, I use packing cubes for organization anyway.  As of right now, I would buy them again. They have already been on 4 trips in the last month and a half.
title: Light, smooth glide and sturdy for the frequent traveler.

author: Ray Sanford
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2021
review_content: Comparing this item to my girlfriend's Away suitcase, similar size. This is about $100 less expensive and has an expandable option (have not used). Very easy to maneuver and when our bags came out after a trip to Hawaii, the Samsonite exterior looked perfect, compared to my GF's Away bag, which seems to attract grime and scuffs. Overall, I normally travel with a carry-on sized bag, this was extremely functional when you need to check a bag
title: Durable, Roomy, and lightweight

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2019
review_content: So glad I bought this set of luggage! I am a road warrior and was really hesitant to switch from soft side to hard side luggage. But, boy am I glad I did! The luggage is super light and the wheels roll like a dream, (no matter how full I pack them). Additionally, the set has effortlessly withstood my multi week flights and the associated airline handling abuse. One downside, but not a deal breaker. There is not enough pockets in the interior. But I solved it quickly by using my Amazon packing cubes. My husband will be making the switch next!
title: Super light and the wheels roll like a dream!

author: Debby A. Dillon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2018
review_content: This set is a perfect set of 3 sizes of suitcases.  It is all you would ever need for traveling.  I am getting older, and even the 2 wheeled luggage is sometimes hard to manage.  These are easy to roll,light weight, and yet seems to have plenty of room.  The locking mechanism is supposed to be TSA approved.  I am afraid to use it.  The directions came in the form of a picture, which is not clear to me.  Perhaps younger people could figure out how to use it, but I could not.  Better directions would have been appreciated.
title: Love these suitcases

author: SJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2021
review_content: This is a sturdy durable and spacious expandable luggage set. If you often carry fragile stuff in your luggage, I strongly recommend it. I was looking for a lightweight, sturdy, and spacious luggage set...this is exactly what I was looking for.
title: Durable and Spacious

author: GAMBIT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2021
review_content: Should have bought a soft shell. Needs a handle on the side for the overhead. Also outside pockets is a must. Good place to put your computer and valuables for TSA. Keeping it but, am keeping it. For what it is it is good. Just buy a colorful one. If you need to check it you will need to spot it. So kind of wish i bought an offbeat color. Hope this helps.
title: Good

author: Alix
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2021
review_content: The suitcase is a little darker than the picture (I bought carribbean blue) and with some green undertone, so looks more like teal color. Not a problem for me I like the color, I wanted a color easy to spot. Otherwise it seems as described. I did not fly with it so I can't judge its durability. It seems good quality. So far I recommend.
title: Teal blue suitcase

author: Chris G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2017
review_content: Lock instructions for this suitcase are incorrect. DO NOT follow the instructions that it comes with, you'll waste a ton of time trying to correct Samsonite's mistake. While set to 000 (or previously set code), press the hidden button with a pen or pencil tip, then release. Set to your desired code and then OPERATE THE OPENING MECHANISM to lock in the code. Again, opening the lock sets the code. Now you can randomize the digits to lock it. The included instructions do not state any of this, so you might end up opening the lock on random digits and setting to an undesired code.Other than Samsonite not knowing/including incorrect locking instructions for their own product, the suitcase is pretty good and holds up nicely. Cool color too.
title: DO NOT follow included locking instructions!

author: Meghan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2018
review_content: I normally have to check my bag anyway so I decided to upsize to a new 24" suitcase.  It's my first hardsided case and I am very happy with it.  It's so much lighter than I expected it to be.  It's easier to clean than my old canvas sided case.  The color is beautiful, the spinner feet are awesome, and the adjustible handle is perfect.  I'm short so I don't need it all the way up.  Having that option is great.  Samonsite has always meant durability.  Remember the gorilla commercials in the 80s?  My case looks brand new 2 flights later.  All I did was wipe down the salt and snow splashes off with a wet cloth.  Think I might go back for the carry on size.
title: So lightweight and easy to pack

author: Shanna A
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2018
review_content: I finally feel like I have grown-up luggage. Love the color, and it feels really well made. Have done two road trips with it quite successfully, will be flying with it twice in the next 6 months. Wheels do not roll well on med. or deep pile carpet or rough outdoor surfaces, but I don't care - I only care how well it rolls through an airport, and it does beautifully on tile, low pile carpet, asphalt and sidewalks.  My husband likes it so much, he just ordered a silver one.
title: Love this luggage!

author: sarah-cate davis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2020
review_content: I was hoping for a bit more from Samsonite. It was super lightweight & the exterior stood up to 3 weeks of traveling through Europe on multiple trains & flights, however it was very hard to maneuver. I was cursing the luggage as I was traveling. It has only 4 spinner wheels which make it hard to travel with. I can back home to pack for a short trip and used my smaller CalPak luggage that has 8 wheels and I realized that’s what I was missing from this Samsonite luggage. I wish I could have returned this luggage, but by the time I came home the return window had closed. Disappointed ☹️
title: Poor maneuverability

author: C. Caldwell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
review_content: We've used it on 3 trips, including one half-way around the world.  Did not know this was possible, but there is no handle on the side of the bag, which we did not realize until trying to check it. Not fun getting it on the belt when they want it on its side. Also not fun while rearranging the luggage puzzle in a car. ;) The other drawback was when my husband pinched his hand from the handle collapsing and got a blood blister. It is a perfectly fine little case, but not 100% worthy of the Samsonite brand.
title: Nothing more than fine.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2021
review_content: This is my family’s second set of this luggage. My daughter received a set for a present several years ago and it has held up wonderfully, so I decided to get myself a set. We recently went on vacation as a family and flew a total of six different flights. They held up fantastic!  A couple of scrapes were on them, which is to be expected, but they were in perfect condition! They are so lightweight and easy to roll around. This is the best luggage I have ever owned!
title: Great luggage!

author: Ria
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2020
review_content: I really liked traveling with the suitcase.  I felt like I packed a lot in it and loved having two sides to pack in instead of one deeper with just pockets on the other side.  The suitcase itself is a little heavy but probably because it isn't cloth like my old set was.  I loved the wheels and on hard floor it was super easy to maneuver but it took more effort when I was on carpeted areas. The handle feels a little loose  and temperamental. If not for that, I would have given it 5 stars.
title: Liked it a lot

author: deelybopper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020
review_content: This is a great, lightweight piece of luggage. Scratch-resistant may be a bit of an overstatement, however. My item was delivered in packaging that was much too flimsy, and had a big gash through a corner. Whatever tore open the box also scratched the heck out of the luggage. No time to exchange it, sadly. Another problem is the instructions for the TSA combo lock. The instructions have no words, only images. And the images do not match the actual lock. With a little intuition, you can figure it out, but they ought to give you the correct instructions with some actual words in them.
title: Great piece of luggage, but arrived damaged

author: Pierre
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2019
review_content: I'm traveling with it for the first time this week but it looks great. Nice-looking materials and does not look cheap. Definitely high-quality so I'd recommend it based on its appearance and style alone. Looking at the other reviews, I'm not worried about the performance aspect either. I got the carry on size so I'm also not worried about it getting tossed around and/or dented. This was also about $60 cheaper than comparable Samsonite carry on luggages from Macys, so that's an extra plus.
title: Sweet Looking Carry On!

author: N Sandy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2019
review_content: IF I COULD GIVE THIS A 00 STAR RATING, I WOULD!!! I purchased this luggage set based upon the Samsonite name brand. This purchase has been the BIGGEST disappointment! I used the largest suitcase to attend a work conference. It seems as if the wheels are too small for the suitcase which makes it is very difficult to navigate on carpet. I hurt my shoulder trying to move the suitcase from my room to the elevator of the hotel! I requested a refund from the seller and no response was received! BUYERS BEWARE!!!
title: HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!!!

author: Obi55
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2020
review_content: Perhaps I expected more... bought this bag because of the brand name.. my current luggages is same brand and it’s been with me allover the world for over 10years and counting.I opted for a second luggage and to be in hard shell as opposed to my current one.. Not sure what to expect but I seriously hope this one lasts or withstands airport handling for a couple years..
title: Hmmm... Aaammm...

author: tg4web
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2018
review_content: One use and the lock broke.  That's pretty pathetic.  And trying to call or chat for help with warranty repairs if the luggage is in another country is really pointless.  They just keep passing you to someone else.
title: One use and the lock broke.  ONE!

author: alan Chen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020
review_content: Got the luggage and it looked great. However the plastic is so thin, you can almost see through it. I’m a frequent flyer and I was very sceptical that it would survive. However the reviews were strong so I’ll take a chance. Remember this is PLASTIC not aluminum. Third trip plastic is completely broken through on one of the wheels and it’s falling off.This isn’t play luggage, it should be able to last more than three trips.Buyer beware.
title: bad

author: Tony Cicirello
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2021
review_content: I bought this as an extended travel case. It has the Samsonite quality I have come to expect. I already own two of the smaller versions of this suitcase and have no complaints.
title: Quality construction

author: Jon J.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2018
review_content: Pros: Lightweight, affordable (I bought for ~75 USD), rolls smoothly, fit and finish seem good, color options, built in TSA approved combo lockCons: the poly-carbonate seems quite thin and can bend inward easily (don't put anything crushable near the corners when packing), the silver is much brighter in person than in the pictures online, no side luggage handleIn general I like this suitcase, it looks like it will do a great job allowing me to pack carry-on luggage while traveling.  However, time will tell as to the durability of the lightweight materials used in construction.  At this point, I would buy it again.
title: Economical Carry-On Suitcase

author: Slim2u
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
review_content: Samsonite has always been known for being a leader in luggage construction. This line of luggage—the Omni—is no exception. It maneuver well and has great storage capacity. Though it is a solid side suitcase, it’s not so heavy that I feel like I’m logging around an old-fashioned hard-sided suitcase. My only regret is that I didn’t buy the entire set. Note, I cannot find the other pieces in the same color.
title: Great Scratch-Resistant Luggage

author: Rachel McPhail
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2021
review_content: Over the weekend, I completed my first trip with the 20" carry-on luggage and the 24" medium suitcase. The carry-on suitcase fit in the overhead bin without problems. I appreciate that the suitcases are light, leaving me plenty of opportunity to fill them with my stuff. The wheels worked flawlessly.My only complaint is the lack of a side handle on the carry-on, which would be helpful for putting the bag in the overhead bin. The images show a side handle; yet, my suitcase didn't have one. I docked one star for the missing side handle.
title: Solid Luggage

author: AC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2018
review_content: I bought this to replace another one where on the very first flight I took that case it came back with a badly dented corner. I pushed it back in shape to some degree but (a) I questioned if that is where it will crack next time and (b) I pushed it back with my fingers, not hammered it back and (c) it looked horrible [after just one use]. I returned it.  This one may be no better other than it's a Samsonite (TBD). I wish we were provided with case shell thickness measurements (10mm, 1/32", etc), that would really help my purchase decision. Without that info, it's a shot in the dark and paying more is not always a guarantee of better.
title: We'll see...

author: Smiley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2020
review_content: This is my third purchase as I have 2 others large bags.  I like that you can get so many things inside that you gave to be careful not to overpack .Be sure to weigh the bag.  Easy mobility.  Taken many times , so far these hold up.
title: Samsonite Omni PC suitcase is awesome

author: Janet W M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020
review_content: If you travel every week and don't want to check your bag, this is the suitcase for you.  It fits into the overhead compartment of most regional jets - there was one where it wouldn't fit and I was able to shove it under my first class seat (it stuck out a bit so I covered my legs with a blanket).
