I can fit a week's worth of clothes in this tiny thing.  It pulls well, but doesn't push quite as smoothly as I'd like.  Still, great case.
title: Great for regular travelers

author: 801Jones
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2017
review_content: Just got my brand new suitcase and discovered the zipper seam stitching inside is torn. Pretty disappointing, returning and contemplating if I even want to try a replacement. If I do, I'll update this review.Update: revised from 2 stars to 4. I received my replacement and everything looks good. Though, it's kinda strange the replacement came in a different box and had different looking materials included than the original detective unit I received.
title: Quality Control needs improvement

author: Jody
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2020
review_content: The 3 piece set is great, exactly what I wanted. Unfortunately, upon the first use a wheel was missing when it came to baggage claim at the airport. As it was covered under the warranty, I had to ship it to a repair center (they wouldn't just sent me a replacement wheel) but they advised it couldn't be repaired and would send me a replacement. The "replacement" is a completely different model and color and now this "set" looks like a random mix of different suitcases which is not what I purchased. I am assuming that Samsonite no longer has replacement parts or a replacement suitcase at all, so if having the whole set is important to you, you may want to browse the Samsonite store to be sure whichever one you are considering is still available through them. The process was easy and the service center people were awesome to work with, but this is a good chunk of money for a matching set to be able to use it as a set one time.
title: Apparently Discontinued Model and Can't be Repaired or Replaced

author: Alison
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2018
review_content: This is my first hardside suitcase. I wasn't sure what I would think of it, but I really like it.  It fit just as much as my soft sided suitcase, plus I felt that the contents were more protected.  I like that there are two sections.  It expands several inches and I was able to fit a weeks work of clothes, make up, hygiene products, etc into this; and I am a huge over packer.  I do miss having extra pouches, however, using packing cubes can help organize your stuff.  The color of this is amazing and stood out on the conveyor belt among a sea of black suitcases.  Because of the unique surface, there are no visible marks or dents after two flights.  It's also extremely lightweight (lighter than my soft suitcase).
title: Spacious, lightweight, sturdy suitcase

author: Diane Harris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2021
review_content: I brought this set after returning the 3 piece set. The reviews were the reasons why I bought this set, along with the durability reviews and the brand name. My husband and I went on an 8 day international trip and my luggage was intake inside and it survived the flight.  We had a delay and running to the flight this luggage held up. My husband now wants a set. I reccomend this set. I have enclosed pictures that show a blue but honestly it gives me a dark teal when its not under a camera. Not to bright but to me the color is just right.
title: So far so good

author: Daisy C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2018
review_content: I had been eyeing this luggage set for a long time now, and when my favourite YouTuber reviewed the set after having traveled for a while with it, I knew it must be a good purchase. I originally ordered the silver set because the photos portrayed the colour as being a dark grey rather than true silver. Don't be fooled! I received the set on time and it's actually a light silver as opposed to the dark grey in the photos. I know, I know... the colour says SILVER, but still. I trusted the photos. I sent back the silver set in exchange for the teal. The teal is pretty true to the photos. I haven't traveled with them yet as I just received them today. I plan on updating this review after our trips later this year.
title: Good Set So Far

author: Brad Braswell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2020
review_content: Everything seemed great until I got to the lock. With the factory combo of 000 the lock will not open or reset per the instructions that came with it, rendering it absolutely useless. I am being sent TDY for work with a few days notice and ordered this suitcase to arrive a just before I have to leave. I can’t contact the vendor and the only options Amazon gives me requires to return or exchange items within 30 days or be charged for a replacement but I’ll be on an extended work trip so that’s not possible. Looks like I’m just out $110 plus whatever I have to buy since I’m backtracked a couple days now without a suitcase.
title: Inoperable lock

author: dpco25
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2019
review_content: I ordered this luggage set with the hope that getting a name-brand like Samsonite will offer a higher quality suitcase set. This luggage is nice looking but basic by Samsonite standards. The shell, handles, and zippers of the luggage seems flimsy and the interior lacks the organizational pockets seen in other (more expensive) Samsonite models. I ended up sending this set back without ever using it. This is probably a decent luggage set for occasional travel use but not for extensive or international travel.
title: Good basic luggage...but not up to normal Samsonite quality!

author: Caty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2019
review_content: It is flimsy.  The lock is cheap.  Difficult to change the combination:. They show using a pen tip.  You need a reset tool that comes with your phone. But it's weak.The overall case is equivalent to a street market suitcase.  You're paying for a  Samsonite brand. It isn't.  There is no side handle.The wheels are cheap and don't have durability.I will use it for car trips but air travel.  It won't make it through airports, baggage handlers.If you can get it on sale, which is what I got it for then buy it but don't spend more than $65.00.Not up to scratch.
title: A fake samsonite suitcase

author: Chris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2021
review_content: I’ve used this carry on for 3 camping rave festivals this year. I was able to get all the gear I needed for a minimalist camping set up in this bag.
title: Durable and packable

author: hb-497
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2019
review_content: I get that wheels are a wear item on rolling luggage, but this was somewhat lightly used luggage, maybe a dozen trips and the front wheels are worn down as shown, meaning I'm basically 'dragging' the rolling luggage.  And of course, they are not designed to be replaced!  (Replacement is possible but requires sawing through the rivet).  Besides the wheels, it has held up ok. But this is meant to be ROLLING luggage.
title: less than one year of use before front wheels non-functional

author: rdlive
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2021
review_content: I would purchase this again, but there are a couple of issues. It’s very lightweight, very mobile, and has lots of packing space. However it lacks a handle on the long side which would be handy for loading into a car or onto a bed. You can only lift it from the top. Also, the directions on how to set the combination lock are ridiculous and misleading. Watch a YouTube to figure out the correct way. Finally, I have to mark it down because the numbers on the lock are so small they’re almost invisible.
title: Nice but has a couple of glitches

author: nobody
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
review_content: Just got the Burnt Orange color but wanted to let others know that the actual color of the suitcase is different than what is pictured on the Amazon page which is a bright orange. I would say the actual color is much closer to what someone would refer to as burnt orange as the orange is very subdued. I like the color though and I happy with it.
title: Burnt Orange color not like pictured on page

author: Nate Sandall
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2020
review_content: I moved to Colombia on October 1st. I packed this suitcase I had bought in August on September 30th. I probably had 80-90 lbs loaded into it and I stood it up and started pulling it and one of the wheels came off! It was the worst possible time! I had just sold my car the night before but was fortunately able to borrow one from a friend who lived nearby so I could run to the mall and buy another suitcase. I had to come back this week to the USA and the return window on this has closed so I can't return it.
title: Wheel broke off on my first use at the worst possible time!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2018
review_content: This is a great suit case. It holds a lot, the zippers both in and out are high quality, it's attractive, easy to pack with the separate compartments, and is fairly lightweight.However, I have to question the durability. We've only had the suitcase a couple of months with a bit of travel (one fairly local and one international trip/flight) and the wheels are already really wearing down and starting to stick/make noises. I'm not sure if there are replacement wheels available but they're going to need replacing very soon. I would expect better quality wheels especially considering my cheap (three-piece set for half the price of one samsonite carry-on) American Traveler suitcase wheels held up much better for 5 years of intensive travel. I only replaced the cases after the airline busted them in checked baggage.
title: Beautiful, spacious, but questionable durability.

author: Habibi_Jovi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2020
review_content: Very good quality and has nice features. it doesn't have a big mesh pocket to hold small lose items like most suitcases do, but it does have a side pouch (barely fits a pair of flat sandals). I recommend to buy at the Samsonite Outlet store for a better price. I was not happy to see my set and other beautiful ones at the outlet store for $40 less than what I paid online.
title: Buy at Outlet Store for Better Price

author: David Benn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2021
review_content: Got 2 of these for Christmas. Second trip I got my bag at the airport.  One of the wheels was missing.  Fortunately American Airlines paid me for the suitcase.  So I buy a second one.  Third trip as I am puting into my house a wheel falls off.  Wheels are only held on with 4 very short screws into plastic.  Certainly not designed to hold up to travel.  Very dissappointed with Samsonite.
title: Does not live up to Samsonite Rep

author: D Coleman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2021
review_content: Love this suitcase!I like the panel that zips closed on one side. When I close the suitcase, all the clothes on that side stays! There is also a zipper pocket along the back of the suitcase. Like the expandable function, but it is lightweight and rolls so easily through the airports.
title: Lightweight, expandable, and pretty color.

author: Cayla B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2017
review_content: The "burnt orange" color is nice: my husband called it "metallic terra-cotta." We will see how this holds up over the next 2 months --  I have two flights and two car trips -- in which I'll use all three of these cases. They seem flexible enough to endure a bit of punishment, and as long as they don't sustain any major dents, I'll be fine. They are actually lighter than my cloth suitcases, which is a plus. I'll update after my trips if these do not function well.
title: Nice color, seem durable.

author: Tina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2021
review_content: This luggage has a great look compared to others. They move nicely and arrived a month early then the 12/4 delivery date expectations (arrived on 11/2, ordered on 10/1).  We have the small one already, so the medium went perfect with it and they do nest (small one fits inside medium) perfectly.
title: Nice luggage

author: Phil from Albuquerque
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2019
review_content: Product is larger than indicated.Ebags.com has the correct size on their web site.Most airlines accept 62 inches. Pretty sure 62.5 would not have been an issue. With 64.5 plus a huge looking bag, I am not so sure.Mine also came with a dent and looked like an item that had been returned before.However, I must say that this thing looked really well built and sturdy, especially given its huge size and low weight.
title: Bigger than advertised. Width + Height + Depth 64.5 not 62.5 inches!

author: Van N.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2019
review_content: We have made numerous trips with these luggage and they're still holding up really well.  We've taken at least 15 flights total (both long and short). The orange color is the cheapest option and actually such a pretty deep orange color AND most importantly, can be identify easily!
title: Durable and light

author: Steven Denning-Garrison
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2018
review_content: needed new luggage and wanted something that looked good, held up and was rated well. Samsonite always has a great brand and this was no different. luggage is well made. Wheels are study, hardside kept up with no scratches over two longs trips to multiple airports. the extension zipper allowed the suitcases to hold more and the TSA locks helped. the color looks great. It came in a set like a Russian nesting doll so the kids loved unpacking it. which also gives you the idea how to store them. They handles have held up so far but do look like one could give me a problem. they are a little pricey compared to similar off brand but the price does bring quality in this case! i would buy again.
title: Great luggage held up all summer

author: J. Lowry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2018
review_content: Upon first use the handle at the top of the bag broke and was useless. The bag was packed with a moderate load, well within normal checked bag limits. The side handle appears strong enough. There is no excuse for a design failure like this, especially with a bag of this size which can easily accommodate more than 50 lbs from a size standpoint. I have requested a refund, not replacement.
title: Top handle failed on first use.

author: Prairie John
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2021
review_content: It's a great case so far. It handles well wheeling it around. My backpack also fits over the handle for all-in-one wheeling through the airport. I like these new ones that use a zipper to go around the 2 hard shells. No worries about rough handling popping open the case. It looks good and is lightweight.
title: So far so good

author: Bob99
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2018
review_content: When one has to make a eleventh hour decision, it is difficult to make selection. I was wavering between Samsonite and Amazon brand. After reading lot of reviews, I decided to go with Samsonite. The product survived my trip to India and came back with everything intact. The material is durable, the wheels are easy to roll on hard floor and on carpets. The zipper is strong and easy to open and close. The built-in lock worked well on repeated open and close. The lift handles worked well. I used big and middle sized luggage bags. I did not use carry on. I am very satisfied with this product.
title: A very good luggage set for price.

author: Christine Van Dillen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2020
review_content: I used this item twice and when I retrieved it from the baggage carousel the wheel broke off.
title: Broken during second use.

author: Norma L McBrayer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
review_content: The size and color are just what I wanted but there is one area, about 5 inches long, where the zipper isn't fully attached to the 'fusliage'. There isn't enough time before my flight to gave it replaced. Since I will be using it as a carry-on it won't be submitted to the rough handling of the airline staff hopefully it will hold up.
title: Just what I wanted...almost.

author: Kat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2021
review_content: I loved this set but in less an a year of ownership one the the wheels crapped out on me. It’s one of the ones that’s on the side when you pull the bag so it is basically unrollable now. That being said I liked the size, the extendable zipper. It always fit in the overhead bin
title: I loved this suitcase until the wheel broke

author: Bonnie Williams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2017
review_content: So far, so good. The medium size is great for a weekend away for 2. Wheels operate smoothly, lightweight, easy to set up combination locks, The hard shell, is not a hard, brittle plastic, it has a little give to the shell, which I would think helps prevent cracking when its handled not so carefully when you have to check your luggage. 1 side on the interior has straps to keep clothing in place, the other side has a mesh panel that zips to cover the entire area, I love this feature, works to keep smaller items, like blow dryer, or toiletries from shifting.
title: High quality, very pleased

author: JilSpan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2018
review_content: I love this little guy.  Small enough to store well and take overnight/weekend trips with. But expandable enough to take enough "stuff" for a 5 day trip. I recommend packing with it unexpanded on your way TO your destination. That way you can expand it at your destination  have room for more coming back. Love the way the wheels roll. Easily pushed or pulled from every direction while upright. Convenient to have the TSA locks so I dont have to stand there and unlock/relock for them. It withstands being tossed around by airline staff well and comes out fairly unscuffed. I particularly love the copper color.  It is easily spotable on the luggage turntable.
title: Awesome yet rugged

author: I. Schmidt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2017
review_content: Happy with purchase, suitcase is functional and survived my Europe trip. Is light, a bit softer than expected, but since even fragile decorated Easted egg shells made it through airline checked luggage without harm, I have no complaints. Handle could be longer for us tall folks. Keeps things tidy and organized. Good price!

author: A. Meyer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2017
review_content: This bag is OVERSIZED by airline rules. I just pulled mine out of the box and it measures 64" linear inches. It is 30" tall from the floor, 21" wide, and 13" deep. That is how airlines measure. The dimensions listed on Amazon and on the tag attached to the bag are BODY ONLY. I looked closer on Samonsite's website and they list: Overall Dimensions: 30.5" x 21.5" x 13.5" which is actually 65.5" (they carefully conceal whether that is expanded or not). Another popular website lists the dimensions as 30.5" x 20.5" x 13.5" (64.5") including wheels and handles - so it's not my tape measure that is defective. It is Samsonite being DECEPTIVE.If you are traveling with this bag without being charged oversize FEES, you are LUCKY. It LOOKS OVERSIZED. See pics next to a bag that is 61" linear. I'm returning this for fear that it is too obvious to get away with. It figured I could get away with 1/2" too big but 2-3" is too much risk to get nailed with $200 each way in oversize fees.I've personally used Samonsite hardside suitcases (2) for the past 20 years (the non-zipper style) and have recommended them to everyone. The only reason my first one was retired after 12 years and 300,000 miles was the TSA broke the latch despite me having left it at 0000. My second one has covered around 200,000 miles and still going strong. I bought this for my wife hoping she'd enjoy similar durability but I'm hugely DISAPPOINTED. Shame on you Samsonite. Why on earth would you try to pass off an oversized bag?
title: OVERSIZED. FEES can be $400 RT. Most reviewers LUCKY but not compliant.

author: JAMES
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2019
review_content: I was ready to get a good set of luggage because I travel a lot but was disappointed that the wheels on the bigger ones start to wander off on their own. When you’re loaded down with bag and your suitcase decides to start going to the left on its own it’s super frustrating. The shell is great and the locks work well. I like the zipper pocket inside. If the wheels worked better I would be over the moon with these
title: The wheels are a bit wonky
